<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A review of the operations and results of the consolidated
    entity and its principal businesses during the financial year is
    contained in the Management Discussion and Analysis.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DIVIDENDS</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    There were no dividends paid during the period. A fully franked
    special dividend of 15 cents per share was approved by the board
    on 17&#160;November 2010 and is payable on 30&#160;November 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SIGNIFICANT
    CHANGES IN THE STATE OF AFFAIRS</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In February 2010 the Group sold the Landmark Financial Services
    (LFS) Loan and Deposit books. The segment was not a discontinued
    operation or classified as held for sale as at 30&#160;September
    2009 and the comparative statement of comprehensive income has
    been re-presented to show the discontinued operation separately
    from continuing operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Except as mentioned above, during and since the end of the
    financial year there were no significant changes in the state of
    affairs of the consolidated entity.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SIGNIFICANT
    EVENTS AFTER BALANCE DATE</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 20&#160;August 2010, AWB Limited announced that it had
    entered into a scheme implementation agreement with Agrium Inc
    (Agrium)., under which Agrium would acquire all of the issued
    capital of AWB under a scheme of arrangement at a price of
    A$1.50 per share, subject to foreign investment and shareholder
    approval.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 4&#160;October 2010, AWB Limited announced that it has been
    advised by Agrium Inc. that it has received clearance from the
    Australian Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) in relation to
    the proposed acquisition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 7&#160;October 2010, the Supreme Court of Victoria approved
    the convening of a meeting of AWB shareholders to consider and
    vote on the proposed Scheme of Arrangement. The Scheme booklet
    was released on 8&#160;October 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Scheme Meeting was held on 16&#160;November 2010 with a
    result in favour of the scheme. The acquisition of AWB by Agrium
    is scheduled for completion on 3&#160;December 2010. As a result
    of the resolution to approve the Scheme of Arrangement and the
    potential future change of ownership of the AWB Limited Group,
    the valuation of assets and liabilities will be reassessed
    following final court approval and settlement, including the
    deferred tax assets of the group. This may lead to the potential
    derecognition of certain deferred tax assets arising in respect
    of group tax losses and temporary differences. The financial
    effects if any as a consequence of a vote in favour of the
    Scheme have not been brought into account in this financial
    report.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A fully franked special dividend of 15 cents per share was
    approved by the board on 17&#160;November 2010 and is payable on
    30&#160;November 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Since 30&#160;September 2010, no other matter or circumstance
    has arisen that has significantly affected, or may significantly
    affect:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    (a)&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the consolidated entity&#146;s operations in future financial

</TD>

</TABLE>

    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>

</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the results of those operations in future financial years; or
</TD>

    <TD width="4%"></TD>

</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">LIKELY
    DEVELOPMENTS AND EXPECTED RESULTS</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The consolidated entity will continue to pursue its policy of
    increasing the profitability and market share of its major
    business segments during the next financial year. Further
    details of likely developments in the operations of the Group
    and its prospects in future financial years are contained in
    various announcements and disclosures to the market that have
    been
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-3

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    made from time to time, including the management discussion and
    analysis. In the opinion of the directors, disclosure of any
    further information may result in unreasonable prejudice to the
    consolidated entity.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In the event that Agrium Inc, is successful in its planned
    acquisition of AWB scheduled for completion on 3&#160;December
    2010, the future strategy for AWB will be further developed and
    may change under Agrium&#146;s ownership.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">ENVIRONMENTAL
    REGULATION&#160;AND PERFORMANCE</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The consolidated entity&#146;s operations are subject to various
    Australian, state and territory environmental legislation and
    regulation. The Board is not aware of any significant
    environmental breaches during the financial year. The
    consolidated entity has been collecting emission and consumption
    data.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">AUDIT AND
    NON-AUDIT SERVICES</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Ernst&#160;&#038; Young is authorised to perform all &#145;audit
    services&#146;, being an examination or review of the financial
    statements of the company in accordance with the laws and rules
    of each jurisdiction in which filings are made, for the purpose
    of expressing an opinion on such statements. The Audit Committee
    approves the provision of audit services as part of the annual
    approval of the audit plan. Where additional audit services not
    contemplated in the annual audit plan are subsequently deemed to
    be necessary during the course of the year, the provision of
    these services is separately approved by the Audit Committee
    prior to commencement of the services.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    AWB Limited has not engaged Ernst&#160;&#038; Young to perform
    any of the following non-audit services:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In addition, all other non-audit services may only be provided
    by Ernst&#160;&#038; Young if the Audit Committee has expressly
    approved the provision of the non-audit service prior to
    commencement of the work, and the performance of the non-audit
    service will not cause the total annual revenue to
    Ernst&#160;&#038; Young from non-audit work to exceed the
    aggregate annual amount of Ernst&#160;&#038; Young&#146;s audit
    fees. The Audit Committee will not approve the provision of a
    non-audit service by Ernst&#160;&#038; Young if the provision of
    the service would compromise Ernst&#160;&#038; Young&#146;s
    independence. The Audit Committee requires Ernst&#160;&#038;
    Young to submit annually to the Audit Committee a formal written
    statement delineating all relationships between
    Ernst&#160;&#038; Young and AWB Limited and its controlled
    entities. The statement includes a report of all audit and
    non-audit fees billed by Ernst&#160;&#038; Young in the most
    recent fiscal year, a statement of whether Ernst&#160;&#038;
    Young is satisfied that the provision of the audit and any
    non-audit services is compatible with auditor independence and a
    statement regarding Ernst&#160;&#038; Young&#146;s internal
    quality control procedures.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A copy of the Auditor&#146;s Independence Declaration is set out
    on page&#160;13 and forms part of this report. The Audit
    Committee considers whether Ernst&#160;&#038; Young&#146;s
    provision of non-audit services to the company is compatible
    with maintaining the independence of Ernst&#160;&#038; Young.
    The Audit Committee also submits annually to the board a formal
    written report describing any non-audit services rendered by
    Ernst&#160;&#038; Young during the most recent fiscal year, the
    fees paid for those non-audit services and explaining why the
    provision of these non-audit services is compatible with auditor
    independence. If applicable, the Audit Committee recommends that
    the Board take appropriate action in response to the Audit
    Committee&#146;s report to satisfy itself of Ernst&#160;&#038;
    Young&#146;s independence.
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-4

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Amounts paid or payable to the auditor for non-audit services
    provided during the year are located in Note&#160;27 to the
    financial statements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For the reasons set out above, the directors are satisfied that
    the provision of non-audit services by the external auditor
    during the year ended 30&#160;September 2010 is compatible with
    the general standard of independence for auditors imposed by the
    Corporations Act 2001.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">INDEMNIFICATION
    AND INSURANCE</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group has not given any indemnity to a current or former
    officer or auditor against any liability that is covered by
    section&#160;199A(2) or (3)&#160;of the Corporations Act 2001,
    nor has the company entered into any relevant agreement under
    which an officer or auditor may be given an indemnity of that
    kind.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under the constitution of AWB Limited, every person who is or
    has been a director, secretary or executive officer of the
    company is indemnified, to the maximum extent permitted by law,
    out of the property of the company against any liability
    incurred by that person as such an officer, other than:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    liability to the company or related body corporate of the
    company; or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    liability arising out of conduct involving a lack of good faith.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In addition, under the constitution every such person is
    indemnified, to the maximum extent permitted by law, out of the
    property of the company against any liabilities for costs and
    expenses incurred by such a person:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    in defending any proceedings relating to that person&#146;s
    position with the company, whether civil or criminal, in which
    judgement is given in that person&#146;s favour or in which that
    person is acquitted or which are withdrawn before judgement; or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    in connection with any administrative proceedings relating to
    that person&#146;s position with the company, except proceedings
    which give rise to proceedings against that person in which
    judgement is not given in that person&#146;s favour or in which
    that person is not acquitted; or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    in connection with any application in relation to any
    proceedings relating to that person&#146;s position with the
    company, whether civil or criminal, in which relief is granted
    to that person under the Corporations Act 2001 by the court.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A Deed of Access, Indemnity and Insurance has been entered into
    between the company and each director and former director of the
    company and agreements have been reached with certain officers
    and former officers of the company under which the company has
    agreed to indemnify the individual in terms similar to the
    indemnities contained in the company&#146;s constitution.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In addition, AWB Limited has provided a limited indemnity to its
    auditor, Ernst&#160;&#038; Young, for all reasonably foreseeable
    liabilities, claims, costs and expenses reasonably incurred by
    it in respect of any claim by a third party related to the audit
    service provided by Ernst&#160;&#038; Young. The indemnity does
    not cover indirect or consequential losses or losses resulting
    from the proved negligent, wrongful or wilful acts or omissions
    of Ernst&#160;&#038; Young.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under the Deeds of Access, Indemnity and Insurance, the company
    has also agreed to maintain a directors&#146; and officers&#146;
    insurance policy. During and since the end of the financial
    year, the company has paid a premium for such a policy for the
    benefit of current and former directors, secretaries and
    officers of the company; current and former directors,
    secretaries and officers of subsidiaries of the company; and
    current and former outside directorships and company secretary
    positions held by employees of the company at the request of the
    company. In accordance with common commercial practice, the
    insurance policy prohibits disclosure of the nature of the
    liability insured against and the amount of the premium.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Except as mentioned above, during and since the end of the
    financial year, the company has not paid any other insurance
    premiums for any person who is or has been an officer or auditor
    of the company.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">ROUNDING</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The amounts contained in this report and in the financial
    statements have been rounded off under the option available to
    the company under Australian Securities and Investments
    Commission (ASIC) Class&#160;Order 98/100. Amounts in this
    report have been rounded off in accordance with that
    Class&#160;Order to the nearest thousand dollars, or in certain
    cases, to the nearest dollar.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Signed in accordance with a resolution of the directors:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 24pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 5%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="o66918o6691802.gif" alt="">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 5%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>Gordon Davis</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 5%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>Managing Director</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    29&#160;November 2010

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-6

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">REMUNERATION
    REPORT (AUDITED)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The information provided in this Remuneration Report has been
    audited as required by section&#160;308(3C) of the Corporations
    Act. This Remuneration Report forms part of the Directors&#146;
    Report.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Reporting
    requirements</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This report outlines the remuneration structure for the Managing
    Director, Senior Executives and non-executive Directors.
    Throughout this Remuneration Report, we use the term
    &#145;Senior Executives&#146; to refer to:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the five most highly remunerated company/group
    executives;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    all other executives who fall within the definition of key
    management personnel of the Group (being those persons with
    authority and responsibility for planning, directing and
    controlling the activities of the Group (KMP) including the
    Managing Director (MD).
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The components of the MD&#146;s remuneration package are
    substantially the same as for other Senior Executives.
    References to Senior Executives should therefore be treated as
    applying to the MD except where otherwise indicated.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Table
    1&#160;&#151; Details of Senior Executives</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->

</TR>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Non-executive
    director remuneration</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Non-executive
    director remuneration policy</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The board&#146;s focus is on strategic direction, long term
    corporate performance and the creation of shareholder value.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The AWB Limited constitution requires that the remuneration of
    non-executive directors be by fixed sum and not a proportion of
    profits or revenue. At the 2004 Annual General Meeting,
    shareholders determined that the maximum aggregate remuneration
    for non-executive directors be $1,200,000 per annum (excluding
    retirement benefits). The fixed fees (paid in cash) are
    determined by the Board with assistance from the
    Nomination&#160;&#038; Remuneration Committee and external
    advisors.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The following principles are applied in determining the amount
    of remuneration for non-executive directors:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the amount of time required for directors to consider board
    matters including preparation time;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    acknowledgement of the personal risk borne as a company director;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    a comparison with professional market rates of remuneration and
    those offered by comparable companies and external independent
    advice as to appropriate levels to remain competitive with the
    market, having regard to companies of similar size and
    complexity; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the desire to attract directors of a high calibre, with
    appropriate levels of expertise and experience.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-7

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Table
    2&#160;&#151; Elements of non-executive director remuneration
    (amounts are inclusive of statutory superannuation)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="26%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="22%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="22%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="22%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Committee Chair fees<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
<DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1px">
    <B>Director fees (per annum)</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>(per annum)</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Other fees/benefits</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Post-employment benefits</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">
<TD>&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
- - $120,000 for director<BR><BR>- $300,000 for Chairman<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(1)</SUP>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
- - $25,000 for Chairman of Audit Committee<BR><BR>- $20,000 for Chairman of Risk Committee
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Directors are entitled to be reimbursed for all business-
    related expenses, including travel, as may be incurred in the
    discharge of their duties.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Superannuation contributions are made on behalf of the
    non-executive directors at a rate of 9% (unless otherwise
    instructed by the director) in accordance with the
    company&#146;s statutory superannuation obligations. There are
    no schemes for retirement benefits for non-executive directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 2pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 12%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>    (1)&#160;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The Chairman receives 2.5 times the amount paid to other
    directors to take into account the greater time commitment and
    responsibility required in the role.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>

    <TD width="4%"></TD>

    <TD>    *&#160;</TD>

<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-8

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Executive
    Remuneration and Reward Policy and structure</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The board has a Nomination&#160;&#038; Remuneration Committee
    which operates under delegated authority from the board. The
    Committee&#146;s activities are governed by a charter (approved
    by the Board on 26&#160;September 2007)&#160;which is available
    on AWB&#146;s website. All members of the Nomination&#160;&#038;
    Remuneration Committee are non-executive directors.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Key
    principles of Executive Remuneration and Reward
    Policy</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The key principles of the Group&#146;s Executive Remuneration
    and Reward Policy are to:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    ensure the remuneration structure provides a clear link between
    performance and reward;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    support AWB&#146;s organisational and people
    objectives&#160;&#151; which are to attract, motivate and retain
    talented employees;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    provide appropriate annual incentives for performance which
    reward executives using financial and non-financial measures of
    performance;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    provide a strong emphasis on long term incentives to link
    rewards to the creation of long term value for shareholders;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    ensure remuneration arrangements are equitable, supporting the
    appropriate deployment of resources and in particular talent
    across the business;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    limit severance payments on termination to pre-established
    contractual arrangements which do not commit the Group to making
    unjustified payments in the event of non-performance.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Executive Remuneration and Reward Policy is governed by the
    Nomination&#160;&#038; Remuneration Committee. It draws a direct
    link between reward and performance through the application of
    variable pay arrangements via short term incentives (bonus
    programs) and long term incentives (equity plans).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The policy ensures remuneration practices are structured to
    support the organisational and people objectives of the Group.
    Previously, the approach has been to provide a base level of
    reward for Senior Executives at the 75th&#160;percentile the
    market reflecting the size, scope and responsibilities of each
    role in addition to variable or &#145;at-risk&#146; components
    which offer potential rewards in line with individual and
    Group-wide performance. The Nomination and Remuneration
    Committee considered this was an appropriate structure due to
    the various challenges and uncertainties being faced by the
    Company in recent financial years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    During the Senior Executive Remuneration review conducted within
    the reporting period, the Nomination and Remuneration Committee
    considered that due to the changing context of the business, it
    would be appropriate that the Senior Executive Remuneration
    Structure shift to a lower base remuneration with a higher
    emphasis on incentives which reward for stretch
    performance&#160;&#151; this would more closely align the
    Company&#146;s remuneration structure with its mid-term business
    strategies and performance targets. The Committee has therefore
    adopted a structure which, in future, will comprise a base
    salary at the 50th&#160;percentile in addition to variable or
    &#145;at risk&#146; components. This approach will apply to any
    new Senior Executive positions created whilst any existing
    positions will gradually move across to the new structure over
    the ensuing years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Fixed
    and at-risk remuneration</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The relative proportions of total 2010 financial year
    remuneration that are at-risk are set out in Table 5.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Table
    5&#160;&#151; Proportions of fixed and at-risk
    remuneration</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-9

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>Fixed remuneration </B>comprises base salary and
    post-employment benefits.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>Base salaries </B>have previously been targeted at the
    75th&#160;percentile of the market reflecting the size, scope
    and responsibilities of each role and are reviewed by the
    Nomination&#160;&#038; Remuneration Committee on an annual
    basis. During the reporting period, the Committee adopted a
    revised approach to the structure of Senior Executive
    remuneration which will result in a move to a base salary
    targeted at the 50th&#160;percentile of the market. Further
    information is provided in &#145;Key principles of Executive
    Remuneration and Reward Policy&#146; above. In reviewing
    remuneration levels, the Committee draws upon market data
    provided by external remuneration consultants including a
    comparison with remuneration similar positions (both scope and
    duties) across multiple sectors. The committee also considers
    peer groups based on market capitalisation and sector as this is
    considered to be the most reliable and valid predictor for
    remuneration one role has been matched.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>Post-employment </B>benefits include statutory superannuation
    and any salary sacrifice arrangements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">At-risk
    remuneration</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    At-risk remuneration includes both short term and long term
    incentives, and is available where specific key performance
    indicators (KPIs) and performance hurdles have been met.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Short
    -Term incentive (STI)</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Table
    6&#160;&#151; Summary of STI program</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="35%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="64%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What is the STI program? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The STI program is an annual cash incentive plan linked to
    performance against specific annual targets approved by the
    Nomination&#160;&#038; Remuneration Committee.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    A cash-based (STI) payment is made to the individual in
    proportion to their level of performance against the annual
    targets.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Who participates in the STI program? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    Senior Executives and the wider employee population.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Is the STI program based on a pool amount for allocation between
    Senior Executives? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    No, the STI program is based on a predetermined percentage of
    the participant&#146;s fixed remuneration and applied against
    target and stretch results as described below in &#145;What
    percentage of total fixed remuneration does the STI program
    represent?&#146;</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Why does the board consider the STI program an appropriate
    incentive? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The STI program is designed to reserve a proportion of
    remuneration at-risk against meeting targets linked to the
    Company&#146;s annual business objectives and to incentivise
    outperformance against key objectives of the business.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Are both target and stretch performance conditions imposed? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    Yes, the STI and the performance conditions set under the STI
    have been designed to motivate and reward high performance. If
    performance exceeds the targets, the STI will deliver higher
    rewards to executives.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What percentage of total fixed remuneration does the STI program
    represent? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The table below shows the percentage of fixed remuneration which
    Senior Executives may earn as an STI (in excess of fixed
    remuneration) if relevant performance measures are met:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="62%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="3" align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>% of total fixed remuneration</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Target</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Stretch</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">
<TD>&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    Managing Director
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    83%
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    100%
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    Other Senior Executives
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="center" valign="bottom">
    25% - 50%
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="center" valign="bottom">
    30% - 60%
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="35%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="64%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What are the performance conditions and measures? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The eligible STI payment comprises team and individual results.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The objectives and measures for Senior Executives are outlined
    in a &#145;Balanced Scorecard&#146; which for the 2010 financial
    year comprised the following targets: financial,
    customer,business processes and capability.  </TD>
</TR>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-10

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="35%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="64%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Balanced Scorecards for the Managing Director and General
    Manager, Landmark also include a safety target (the measure
    being Lost Time Injury Frequency Rate (LTIFR)) as these
    positions have the greatest ability to influence performance
    against this target.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The objectives were weighted in accordance with the relevance of
    each component to the nature of the role.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Why were these conditions chosen? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    These measures are chosen as they directly align the
    individual&#146;s reward to the KPIs of the Group and to its
    strategy and performance. Additionally, non-financial measures
    are included as they are considered to be indicators of the
    sustainability of future shareholder value.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Who assesses the performance of the Senior Executives and how
    are the performance conditions measured? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    At the end of the financial year, the Nomination&#160;&#038;
    Remuneration Committee reviews the performance of the Group, the
    relevant business units and individual Senior Executives.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The committee approves the STI payment to be made to each Senior
    Executive and in doing so seeks an assessment from the Managing
    Director(other than in relation to his own performance) on
    performance against the Balanced Scorecards. The Committee
    assesses the Managing Director&#146;s performance and makes a
    recommendation to the board in relation to the Managing
    Director&#146;s STI payment. This method of assessment was
    chosen as the Committee is able to provide an objective
    assessment of the individual&#146;s performance. The Nomination
    and Remuneration Committee is provided with discretion to pay
    higher rewards in extraordinary circumstances where the
    performance of a Senior Executive has warranted this.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    How did Senior Executives perform against their targets? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    At a group level, the financial results for the 2010 financial
    year were under target levels. However, the Nomination and
    Remuneration Committee determined that the significant
    contribution made by certain executives to the successful
    corporate activity undertaken during the year justified the STI
    payments at target levels.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Long-term
    incentive (LTI)</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Table 7 summarises the terms of the Performance Rights Plan
    (PRP) grant to Senior Executives effective 1&#160;October 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Long Term Incentive Plan for grants effective on
    1&#160;October 2009 differed from prior years plans, with the
    key change being to the performance measurement. Rather than
    being measured on Absolute Total Shareholder Return (ATSR), the
    performance hurdles for this grant are based on Underlying
    Return on Funds Employed. The number of performance rights
    granted to each senior executive was determined commensurate
    with the individual&#146;s ability to contribute to shareholder
    return and also to ensure market competitiveness for their total
    package. Shareholders approved the grant of Performance Rights
    to the Managing Director under the terms of this plan at the
    2009 Annual General Meeting.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As contemplated by the Scheme Implementation Deed between Agrium
    Inc and AWB Limited, the Board gave notice to the holders of AWB
    Performance Rights on 7&#160;October 2010 that their performance
    rights had become vested. In view of the Agrium proposal, no
    performance rights were granted on 1&#160;October 2010, pending
    a review of ongoing incentive arrangements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In prior years, the measure of Total Shareholder Return (TSR)
    under the company&#146;s PRPs has varied between ATSR, Relative
    TSR (RTSR) and a combination of both ATSR and RTSR with measures
    weighted 30% and 70% respectively. For ATSR plans, vesting
    begins if TSR is at least 14% over a three year performance
    period and for the RTSR plans, vesting begins to occur
    proportionately if AWB Limited&#146;s ranking during the
    three-year perform period reaches the 50th&#160;percentile. The
    share prices is relative to the companies which comprise the
    S&#038;P/ASX200 Industrial Index.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-11

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Of the PRP performance periods which ended during the 2010
    financial year, no performance rights vested as the performance
    hurdles relevant to each plan were not achieved.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Table
    7&#160;&#151; Summary of LTI program related to the reporting
    period (grant date: 1&#160;October 2009)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="35%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="64%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What is the LTI program? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    A long term reward plan where rights over unissued shares in the
    company are issued to participants on an annual basis. Vesting
    of performance rights occur if prescribed underlying ROFE
    performance hurdles are met. On exercise, each performance right
    entitles the participant to one ordinary share in AWB Limited.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What is the purpose of the LTI program? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    To incentivise executives to increase long term shareholder
    value by aligning their reward with the company&#146;s long term
    performance.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Who participates in the LTI program? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    Senior Executives and other selected executives who occupy
    positions which have a significant impact on company performance.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What are the LTI award levels? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    For the Managing Director, the award level is 800,000
    performance rights. For other Senior Executives the award levels
    range from the equivalent of 55,000 to 340,000 performance
    rights depending on the individual&#146;s ability to influence
    shareholder value.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    How is reward delivered under the LTI program? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    Participants are provided with rights over shares in AWB Limited
    which become exercisable if the performance of the company
    exceeds certain Return On Funds Employed (ROFE) hurdles.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Do participants pay for the Performance Rights? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    No, there is no fee payable for receiving or exercising
    performance rights.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What is the performance hurdle? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    Underlying Return on Funds Employed (ROFE) over a three-year
    performance period.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    How is ROFE measured? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    Underlying ROFE is calculated on the underlying EBIT divided by
    shareholder funds plus interest bearing debt (underlying results
    are calculated pre the impact of significant items). This
    measure ensures management are focused on the efficient use of
    capital regardless of the source of funds employed
    (equity/debt). The Board then determines whether the underlying
    ROFE hurdles have been achieved.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="58%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="37%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">

    </B>
</TD>

</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="35%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="64%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Why does the company think the Underlying ROFE hurdle is
    appropriate? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The Board considered that given the number of unusual external
    factors impacting the company, it was appropriate for the LTI
    Program to be based on an internal measure. The Board believed
    it would be in the company&#146;s best interests if Senior
    Executives were incentivised to improve the Company&#146;s
    performance on metrics that they had the ability to positively
    affect and which still ensured strong alignment to long term
    share value growth.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What if a Senior Executive ceases employment? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    If the rights have vested, the participant has the earlier of
    90&#160;days or one year after the last day of the performance
    period to which the performance right became a vested
    performance right to exercise their rights.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-12

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="35%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="64%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    If the rights have not vested, generally they will lapse. In
    circumstances of death, redundancy or retirement, some rights
    may still become exercisable.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    In the event of serious misconduct, performance rights lapse on
    cessation of employment whether vested or not.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    What happens in the event of a change in control? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    The Board has the discretion to vest performance rights in
    certain circumstances including change in control.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Does re-testing apply? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    No</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    Is there a policy to prevent hedging? </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    Yes, the Group&#146;s Share Dealing Guidelines prevent
    participants of PRPs from entering into any transaction which
    would have the effect of hedging or otherwise transferring to
    any other person the risk of any fluctuation of the value of
    performance rights under the Plan. A copy of the Share Dealing
    Guidelines is available on the Group&#146;s website. Breach of
    the Group&#146;s Share Dealing Guidelines would be regarded as a
    breach of Group policy and may result in disciplinary action
    against  employee up to and including dismissal.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Service
    Agreements</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    All Senior Executives have open-ended contracts which may be
    terminated by AWB at any time with three months notice or
    payment in lieu of notice. In addition to the notice period,
    Senior Executives are entitled to a severance allowance of six
    months (Philip Gentry, Mitch Morison, Graeme Jacobs, and John
    Russell) or nine months (Gordon Davis) payment of the then
    current total cost of their remuneration package, excluding
    incentive payments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Board did not approve any changes to the severance payments
    for any executives.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Retention
    of key executives</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    During the 2008 financial year, the Company faced a number of
    unprecedented challenges. These included the loss of the Single
    Desk, the opening up of bulk wheat exports to other companies,
    uncertainty regarding whether the company would be able to
    reform its dual share structure and the continued threat from
    several class actions. As a result of these challenges, the
    Board considered that it would be appropriate and responsible to
    approve a number of retention mechanisms to ensure that key
    executives remained with the Company during these uncertain
    times. The Board approved the retention payments on
    5&#160;August 2008.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For Senior Executives the retention mechanisms included
    providing a retention payment if the individual remains employed
    by the Company as at 15&#160;December 2009 and 15&#160;December
    2010. Details of 2010 retention payments which are included in
    the Financial Statements on an accruals basis are outlined in
    the below table. No new retention grants were made in 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Table
    8&#160;&#151; Retention payments&#160;&#151; 2009 &#038;
    2010</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
