<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Managing
    Director&#146;s remuneration</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The following specific arrangements apply to the Managing
    Director&#146;s remuneration.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-13

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Managing
    Director&#146;s LTI</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    At the 2009 Annual General Meeting, shareholders approved the
    grant of Performance Rights to AWB&#146;s Managing Director, Mr
    Davis. The terms of the Performance Rights granted effective
    1&#160;October 2009 are detailed in table 7 and are identical to
    the rights of other Senior Executives with the exception of the
    number of rights granted.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In prior years, Mr Davis had been granted with
    &#145;phantom&#146;  share rights, as detailed below:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    At the 2002 Annual General Meeting, shareholders were asked to
    approve a PRP for the Managing Director on similar terms to the
    plans offered to other eligible senior executives. As
    shareholder approval for the Managing Director&#146;s plan was
    not granted, the Board made a decision to link the Managing
    Director&#146;s reward with long-term company performance by
    offering the Managing Director a plan mirroring the PRP with the
    exception that &#145;phantom&#146; share rights would be issued
    which would be paid in cash subject to meeting or exceeding the
    necessary performance hurdles. The performance hurdles for the
    Managing Director are identical to the PRP hurdles. The varying
    value of the scheme is reflected in the accrual for share based
    payment column in the table below.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">KMP of
    AWB Limited Group and AWB
    Limited<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(1)</SUP></FONT></I></B>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>    (1)&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">    KMP remuneration in this table includes those meeting the
    definition of KMP under AASB 124 (excluding non-executive
    directors) as well as the five executives who received the
    highest remuneration who were not KMP for the year in accordance
    with the Corporations Act 2001.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>    (2)&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">    Other remuneration for other key management personnel, includes
    motor vehicles, housing benefits, retention payments, long
    service leave provision and other allowances subject to fringe
    benefits tax.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>    (3)&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">    Retirement benefits relates to termination payments made during
    the year.
</TD>
</TR>

    A-15

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">2010</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Table
    12&#160;&#151; Performance rights granted to KMP</FONT></B>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The accounting value of the senior executives&#146; performance
    rights that were granted, exercised and lapsed in the 2010
    financial year is detailed in Table 15. As these values
    represent accounting values, the executive may not actually
    receive these amounts.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The value of lapsed performance rights is based on accounting
    value. This value is included to address our reporting
    obligations only. Where these instruments lapse, there is no
    benefit at all to the executive, and therefore no transfer of
    any equity or equity-related instrument.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Shares
    issued on exercise of performance rights</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    During or since the end of the financial year, the company
    issued ordinary shares as a result of the exercise of
    performance rights as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Group
    performance</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our remuneration policy links the remuneration of executives and
    the wider employee population with short term and long term
    performance. The Nomination&#160;&#038; Remuneration Committee
    approves the overall share of profit distributed to employees
    based on the Group&#146;s performance.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The total return to an investor over a given period consisted of
    the combination of dividends paid and the movement in market
    value of their shares over that period.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The closing share price on the ASX of AWB Limited securities on
    30&#160;September 2010 was $1.48. AWB Limited&#146;s highest and
    lowest share prices in the year ended 30&#160;September 2010
    were $1.49 (20&#160;August 2010)&#160;and $0.87 (26&#160;March
    2010)&#160;respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In addition to TSR, company performance is also reflected in the
    movement in the company&#146;s earnings per share. Table 17
    shows AWB Limited&#146;s basic earnings per share (EPS) history
    for the past five years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="o66918o6691803.gif" alt="(ERNST & YOUNG LOGO)">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Auditor&#146;s
    Independence Declaration to the Directors of AWB
    Limited</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In relation to our audit of the financial report of AWB Limited
    for the financial years ended 30&#160;September 2010 and
    30&#160;September 2009, to the best of my knowledge and belief,
    there have been no contraventions of the auditor independence
    requirements of the <I>Corporations Act 2001 </I>or any
    applicable code of professional conduct.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="o66918o6691804.gif" alt="(-s- ERNST & YOUNG)">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Ernst&#160;&#038; Young
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="o66918o6691805.gif" alt="(-s- T M DRING)">
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    T M Dring
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Partner
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Melbourne
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    29&#160;November 2010
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    under Professional Standards Legislation

    A-22

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-23

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">AWB
    LIMITED<BR>
    </FONT></B>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    A-24

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    LIMITED<BR>

    <A HREF='#125'><B>25</B></A>

</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-25

<DIV align="left">
<!-- /TOC -->
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,NS -->
<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">AWB
    LIMITED<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    AND FORMING PART&#160;OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">FOR THE YEAR
    ENDED 30&#160;SEPTEMBER 2010
    </FONT>
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">1.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='101'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SUMMARY
    OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(a)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Basis
    of preparation</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The financial report is a general purpose financial report which
    has been prepared in accordance with Australian Accounting
    Standards, other authoritative pronouncements of the Australian
    Accounting Standards Board and the <I>Corporations Act 2001</I>.
    The financial report has also been prepared on a historical cost
    basis, except for derivative financial instruments,
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">available-for-sale</FONT>
    investments, inventories held in commodity broker-trader
    arrangements and fixed rate loans which have been measured at
    fair value.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The financial report is presented in Australian dollars and all
    values are rounded to the nearest thousand dollars ($000) unless
    otherwise stated under the option available to the company under
    ASIC Class&#160;Order 98/100.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Compliance
    with IFRS</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The financial report complies with Australian Accounting
    Standards and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This annual financial report is prepared in accordance with
    Australian equivalents to International Financial Reporting
    Standards (AIFRS) which differ in some respects from Canadian
    GAAP (as set out in note&#160;43 in the financial report).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Critical
    accounting estimates</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The preparation of financial statements in conformity with
    Australian Accounting Standards requires the use of certain
    critical accounting estimates. It also requires management to
    exercise its judgement in the process of applying the
    Group&#146;s accounting policies. The areas involving a higher
    degree of judgement or complexity, or areas where assumptions
    and estimates are significant to the financial statements are
    disclosed in Note (1ab).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This report was authorised for issue on 29&#160;November 2010 in
    accordance with a resolution of the directors.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(b)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Basis
    of consolidation</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The consolidated financial statements comprise the financial
    statements of AWB Limited and its subsidiaries (&#145;the
    Group&#146;) (as outlined in Note&#160;36).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The financial statements of subsidiaries are prepared for the
    same reporting period as the parent company with the exception
    of AWB India Private Limited (reporting date 31&#160;March) and
    AWB Brasil Trading SA (reporting date 31&#160;December). AWB
    India Private Limited and AWB Brasil Trading SA prepare, for
    consolidation purposes, additional financial statements as of
    the same date as the financial statements of AWB Limited.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Consistent accounting policies have been applied to subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In preparing the consolidated financial statements, all
    intercompany balances and transactions, including unrealised
    profits arising from intra-group transactions, have been
    eliminated in full.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Subsidiaries are consolidated from the date on which control is
    transferred to the Group and cease to be consolidated from the
    date on which control is transferred out of the Group. Where
    there is loss of control of a subsidiary, the consolidated
    financial statements include the results for the part of the
    reporting period which AWB Limited has control.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Investments in subsidiaries held by AWB Limited are accounted
    for at cost in the separate financial statements of the parent
    entity.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Interests in associates are equity accounted (see Note&#160;1(d)
    below).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">AWB
    Pools</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group operates grain pools on behalf of growers and has
    legal title over the pool inventory, however, the majority of
    the risks and benefits associated with the pools, principally
    price risk and benefit, together with credit risk, are
    attributable to growers. As a result, pool inventory and other
    related balances held by the Group on behalf of growers are not
    recognised in the Group&#146;s financial statements. Separate
    financial records are maintained for these grain pools.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(c)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Comparatives</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Except for the restatement discussed below, comparative data has
    been presented on a consistent basis with the prior reporting
    period, unless classification of items in the financial report
    have been amended, in which case comparative amounts have been
    reclassified.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-26

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <!-- XBRL -->
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 0pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(d)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Investment
    in associates</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group&#146;s investment in its associates are accounted for
    under the equity method of accounting in the consolidated
    financial statements and at cost in the parent. The associates
    are entities over which the Group has significant influence and
    which are neither subsidiaries nor joint ventures.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The financial statements of the associates are used by the Group
    to apply the equity method. Both use consistent accounting
    policies.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The investment in associates is carried in the consolidated
    balance sheet at cost plus post-acquisition changes in the
    Group&#146;s share of net assets of the associates, less any
    impairment in value. The consolidated income statement reflects
    the Group&#146;s share of the results of operations of the
    associates. Dividends receivable from associates are recognised
    in the parent entity&#146;s income statement, while in the
    consolidated financial statements they reduce the carrying
    amount of the investment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Where there has been a change recognised directly in the
    associate&#146;s equity, the Group recognises its share of any
    changes and discloses this, when applicable, in the consolidated
    statement of changes in equity.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(e)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Joint
    ventures</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Jointly
    controlled assets</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group has an interest in a joint venture that is classified
    as jointly controlled assets The Group recognises its interest
    in the jointly controlled assets by recognising its interest in
    the assets and liabilities of the joint venture. The Group also
    recognises the expenses that it incurs and its share of the
    income that it earns from the sale of goods or services by the
    joint venture.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Joint
    venture entities</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The interest in a joint venture partnership is accounted for in
    the consolidated financial statements using the equity method
    and is carried at cost by the parent entity. Under the equity
    method, the share of the profits or losses of the partnership is
    recognised in the income statement, and the share of movements
    in reserves is recognised in reserves in the consolidated
    balance sheet.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(f)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Foreign
    currency translation</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Functional
    and presentation currency</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Both the functional and presentation currency of AWB Limited and
    its Australian subsidiaries is Australian dollars ($). The
    consolidated financial statements are presented in Australian
    dollars. The Group&#146;s offshore subsidiaries use the
    functional currencies of the primary economic environment in
    which the entity operates (&#145;the functional currency&#146;),
    this is primarily United States dollars.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Transactions
    and balances</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Foreign currency transactions are initially recorded in the
    functional currency by applying the exchange rates ruling at the
    date of the transaction. Monetary assets and liabilities
    denominated in foreign currencies are translated at the rate of
    exchange ruling at the balance sheet date.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Non-monetary items that are measured in terms of historical cost
    in a foreign currency are translated using the exchange rate as
    at the date of the initial transaction. Non-monetary items
    measured at fair value in a foreign currency are translated
    using the exchange rates at the date when fair value was
    determined.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Group
    companies</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The results and financial position of all the Group&#146;s
    entities that have a functional currency different from the
    presentation currency are translated into the presentation
    currency as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    assets and liabilities for balance sheet presented are
    translated at the closing rate at the date of that balance sheet;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    income and expenses for each income statement are translated at
    average exchange rates; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    exchange variations resulting from translation are recognised in
    the foreign currency translation reserve in equity.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Group entities that have a different functional currency from
    the presentation currency are:
</DIV>

</TD>

    AWB Geneva SA (United States dollars);
</TD>
</TR>

</TD>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-27

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <!-- XBRL -->
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 0pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    AWB Krishi Upaaj Vipnan Parisar (Talera) Private Limited (Indian
    rupees); and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    AWB Mauritius Private Ltd (United States dollars).
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On disposal of a foreign entity, the deferred cumulative amount
    recognised in equity relating to that particular foreign
    operation is recognised in the income statement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(g)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Property,
    plant and equipment</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Property, plant and equipment is stated at historical cost less
    accumulated depreciation and any impairment losses.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Depreciation is calculated on a straight-line basis at the
    following rates:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Land&#160;&#151; not depreciated;
</TD>
</TR>
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">
    </FONT>

<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Buildings&#160;&#151; 2%;
</TD>
</TR>
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">
    </FONT>

<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Leasehold improvements&#160;&#151; 7% to 50%; and
</TD>
</TR>
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">
    </FONT>

<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Plant and equipment&#160;&#151; 5% to 33%.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Depreciation rates are determined using the estimated useful
    life of assets as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Buildings 50&#160;years;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Leasehold improvements 2 to 14.3&#160;years; and
</TD>
</TR>
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">
    </FONT>

<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Plant and equipment 3 to 20&#160;years.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The assets&#146; residual values, useful lives and amortisation
    methods are reviewed, and adjusted if appropriate, at each
    financial year end.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Impairment</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The carrying values of non current assets are tested for
    impairment when events or changes in circumstances indicate the
    carrying value may not be recoverable.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For an asset that does not generate largely independent cash
    inflows, the recoverable amount is determined for the
    cash-generating unit to which the asset belongs. If any
    indication of impairment exists, the assets or cash-generating
    units are written down to their recoverable amount.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    An item of property, plant and equipment is derecognised upon
    disposal or when no future economic benefits are expected to
    arise from the continued use of the asset. Any gain or loss
    arising on derecognition of the asset (calculated as the
    difference between the net disposal proceeds and the carrying
    amount of the item) is included in the consolidated income
    statement in the period the item is derecognised.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(h)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Goodwill</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Goodwill acquired in business combinations is initially measured
    at cost, being the excess of the cost of the business
    combination over the Group&#146;s interest in the net fair value
    of the acquiree&#146;s identifiable assets, liabilities and
    contingent liabilities. Following initial recognition, goodwill
    is measured at cost less any accumulated impairment losses.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Goodwill is not amortised but is tested for impairment annually
    or more frequently if events or changes in circumstances
    indicate that the carrying value may be impaired.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For the purpose of impairment testing, goodwill acquired in a
    business combination is, from the acquisition date, allocated to
    each of the Group&#146;s cash-generating units that are expected
    to benefit from the synergies of the combination, irrespective
    of whether other assets or liabilities of the Group are assigned
    to those units. Units to which the goodwill is allocated are:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Landmark
</TD>
</TR>
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">
    </FONT>

<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Landmark Copeland Medway Pty Ltd;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Genfarm
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Temora Grains Pty Ltd; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Stocklease Pty Ltd.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Impairment is determined by assessing the recoverable amount of
    the cash-generating unit, to which the goodwill relates. AWB
    Limited performs its impairment testing during September each
    year or as need be using a value in use, discounted cash flow
    methodology. Further details on the methodology and assumptions
    used are outlined in note&#160;12.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    When the recoverable amount of the cash-generating unit is less
    than the carrying amount, an impairment loss is recognised.
    Impairment losses recognised are not subsequently reversed.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-28

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <!-- XBRL -->
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 0pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(i)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Intangible
    assets</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Acquired
    both separately and from a business combination</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Intangible assets acquired separately or in a business
    combination are initially measured at cost. The cost of an
    intangible asset acquired in a business combination is its fair
    value as at the date of acquisition. Following initial
    recognition, intangible assets are carried at cost less any
    accumulated amortisation and any accumulated impairment losses.
    Internally generated intangible assets, excluding capitalised
    system development costs, are not capitalised and expenditure is
    recognised in the income statement in the year in which the
    expenditure is incurred. System development costs are
    capitalised when they are expected to produce future economic
    benefits.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The useful lives of intangible assets are assessed to be either
    finite or indefinite. Other than goodwill, all of AWB
    Limited&#146;s intangible assets are assessed to have finite
    useful lives. Intangible assets with finite lives are amortised
    over the useful life and tested for impairment when there is an
    indication that the intangible asset may be impaired. The
    amortisation period and method for an intangible with a finite
    life is reviewed at least at each financial year-end. Changes in
    the expected useful life or the expected pattern of consumption
    of future economic benefits embodied in the asset are accounted
    for prospectively by changing the amortisation period or method,
    as appropriate, which is a change in accounting estimate.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Intangible assets with finite useful lives are amortised as
    follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Licences 7 to 10&#160;years; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    System development costs 2.5 to 5&#160;years.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(j)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Investments</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Investments in controlled entities are held at cost in AWB
    Limited&#146;s balance sheet.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Available-for-sale</FONT>
    investments, principally equity securities, are initially
    recognised at fair value plus directly attributable transaction
    costs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    After initial recognition,
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">available-for-sale</FONT>
    investments are measured at fair value with gains or losses
    recognised as a separate component of equity until the
    investment is derecognised or determined to be impaired, at
    which time the cumulative gain or loss previously reported in
    equity is included in the income statement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For investments that are actively traded in organised financial
    markets, fair value is determined by reference to quoted market
    bid prices at the close of business on the balance sheet date.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For investments where there is no quoted market price, fair
    value is determined by reference to the current market value of
    another instrument which is substantially the same.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(k)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Inventories</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Inventories, other than those held as a commodity broker-trader
    are valued at the lower of cost and net realisable value. Net
    realisable value is the estimated selling price in the ordinary
    course of business, less estimated costs of completion and the
    estimated costs necessary to make the sale.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    AWB grain acquisition and trading activities are conducted as a
    commodity broker-trader, where inventories are acquired
    principally for the purpose of selling in the near future and
    generating a profit from fluctuations in price or
    broker-traders&#146; margin. Grain acquisition and trading
    inventories are measured at fair value less costs to sell with
    changes in fair value less costs to sell recognised in the
    consolidated income statement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Biological
    assets</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Biological assets are dairy cattle held by the group for the
    production of meat. Dairy cattle is measured at cost on initial
    recognition and at fair value less estimated point of sale cost
    on each reporting date. Costs to sell include all costs that
    would be necessary to sell the dairy cattle. Changes in the fair
    value less costs to sell of dairy cattle and sheep are
    recognised in the income statement in the year they arise.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(l)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Loans
    and advances</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Trade
    receivables</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Trade receivables, which generally have
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">30-day</FONT>
    terms, are recognised initially at fair value and subsequently
    measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method,
    less an allowance for credit impairment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    An estimate for provision for impairment is made when there is
    objective evidence that the Group will not be able to collect
    all amounts due according to the original terms of receivables.
    Bad debts are written off when identified.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Loans and
    advances</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Loans and advances are non derivative financial assets with
    fixed or determinable payments that are not quoted in an active
    market. They arise when the Group provides money or goods or
    services directly to a debtor with no intention of selling the
    receivable. Loans and advances on variable rate terms are
    initially recognised at fair value plus transaction costs that
    are directly attributable to the issue of the loan or advance.
    They are subsequently measured at amortised cost using the
    effective interest method. Refer to Note&#160;1(ad) for the
    accounting policy in relation to loans and advances on fixed
    rate terms. Loans and advances are derecognised when the rights
    to receive cash flows have expired or the group has transferred
    substantially all the risks and rewards of ownership.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-29

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <!-- XBRL -->
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 0pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Impairment
    of loans and advances</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If there is objective evidence that an impairment loss on loans
    and advances carried at amortised cost has been incurred, the
    amount of the loss is measured as the difference between the
    asset&#146;s carrying amount and the present value of estimated
    future cash flows (excluding future credit losses that have not
    been incurred) discounted at the financial asset&#146;s original
    effective interest rate (i.e. the effective interest rate
    computed at initial recognition). The carrying amount of the
    assets is reduced either directly or through use of an allowance
    account. The amount of the loss is recognised in the income
    statement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group first assesses whether objective evidence of
    impairment exists individually for financial assets that are
    individually significant, and individually or collectively for
    financial assets that are not individually significant. If it is
    determined that no objective evidence of impairment exists for
    an individually assessed financial asset, whether significant or
    not, the asset is included in a group of financial assets with
    similar credit risk characteristics and that group of financial
    assets is collectively assessed for impairment. Assets that are
    individually assessed for impairment and for which an impairment
    loss is or continues to be recognised are not included in a
    collective assessment of impairment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If, in a subsequent period, the amount of the impairment loss
    decreases and the decrease can be related objectively to an
    event occurring after the impairment was recognised, the
    previously recognised impairment loss is reversed. Any
    subsequent reversal of an impairment loss is recognised in
    profit or loss, to the extent that the carrying value of the
    asset does not exceed its amortised cost at the reversal date.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(m)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Cash
    and cash equivalents</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Cash and cash equivalents in the balance sheet comprise cash at
    bank and on hand and short-term deposits with an original
    maturity of three months or less that are readily convertible to
    known amounts of cash and which are subject to an insignificant
    risk of changes in value.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For the purposes of the cash flow statements, cash and cash
    equivalents consist of cash and cash equivalents as defined
    above, net of outstanding bank overdrafts. Bank overdrafts are
    included within interest bearing loans and borrowings on the
    balance sheet.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(n)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Interest
    bearing loans and borrowings</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    All loans and borrowings are initially recognised at the fair
    value of the consideration received less directly attributable
    transaction costs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    After initial recognition, interest-bearing loans and borrowings
    are subsequently measured at amortised cost using the effective
    interest method. Fees paid for the establishment of loan
    facilities that are yield related are included as part of the
    carrying amount of the loans and borrowings, and amortised over
    the life of the loan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Borrowing
    costs</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Borrowing costs are recognised as an expense when incurred. AWB
    Limited does not currently hold qualifying assets but, if it
    did, the borrowing costs directly associated with these assets
    would be capitalised (including other associated costs directly
    attributable to the borrowing and temporary investment income
    earned on the borrowing).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(o)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Provisions</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Provisions are recognised when the Group has a present
    obligation (legal or constructive) as a result of a past event,
    it is probable that an outflow of resources embodying economic
    benefits will be required to settle the obligation and a
    reliable estimate can be made of the amount of the obligation.
    All provisions are expected to be settled within the next
    12&#160;months, as such they have not been discounted, except
    for long service leave provisions. Refer note p(ii).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(p)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employee
    benefits</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(i)&#160;Wages,
    salaries, annual leave and sick leave</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Liabilities for wages and salaries, including non-monetary
