<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-41

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <!-- XBRL -->
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 0pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(b)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Nature
    of asset</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The group owned livestock which it kept on agistment farms
    throughout Victoria. Livestock is purchased, grown and then sold
    for the purpose of making a profit at the point of turnover in
    comparison to initial cost.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(c)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Significant
    assumptions</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Significant assumptions made in determining the net market value
    of the livestock are:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    livestock cycles from acquisition to disposal have a defined
    period of 180 to 200&#160;days for export orders; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    all livestock will turnover, with the exception of
    &#145;deaths&#146; which are estimated to be at a rate of 0.25%.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Livestock is measured on initial recognition and at each
    reporting date at its fair value less estimated
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">point-of-sale</FONT>
    costs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Fair value of livestock is based on the best available estimate
    for livestock with similar attributes. In this case, the best
    available estimate being the current market price of livestock
    ready for immediate export.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Any gain or loss arising on initial recognition of livestock at
    fair value less estimated
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">point-of-sale</FONT>
    costs and from a change in fair value less estimated
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">point-of-sale</FONT>
    costs is included in profit or loss in the period in which it
    arises.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">8.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='108'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">CURRENT
    ASSETS&#160;&#151; OTHER ASSETS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="89%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-42

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <!-- XBRL -->
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 0pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->
<!-- XBRL,n -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

    Fair value of listed securities and memberships is determined by
    reference to quoted market bid prices at the close of business
    on balance date.

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Five Star
    Flour Mills and Five Star Feed Mills are based in Egypt.
    </FONT>

    The Group holds 23.7% directly. The other 9% is indirectly held
    through FSFM for a total holding of 32.7%.

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(b)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Description
    of the Group&#146;s intangible assets</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">System
    development</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    System development costs are carried at cost less accumulated
    amortisation and accumulated impairment losses. This intangible
    asset has been assessed as having a finite life and is amortised
    using the straight-line method over a period of 2.5&#160;&#151;
    5&#160;years. The amortisation has been recognised in the income
    statement in the line item &#145;other expenses&#146;. If an
    impairment indication arises, the recoverable amount is
    estimated and an impairment loss is recognised to the extent
    that the recoverable amount is lower than the carrying amount.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Licences</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Licences are carried at cost less accumulated amortisation and
    accumulated impairment losses. This intangible asset has been
    assessed as having a finite life and is amortised using the
    straight-line method over a period of 7-10&#160;years. The
    amortisation has been recognised in the income statement in the
    line item &#145;other expenses&#146;. If an impairment
    indication arises, the recoverable amount is estimated and an
    impairment loss is recognised to the extent that the recoverable
    amount is lower than the carrying amount.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-45

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Other</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Other intangible assets relate to non-contractual customer
    relationships or customer lists purchased as part of a business
    combination. Other intangibles assets are carried at cost less
    accumulated amortisation and accumulated impairment losses.
    These intangible assets have been assessed as having a finite
    life and are amortised using the straight-line method over a
    period of 5-8&#160;years. The amortisation has been recognised
    in the income statement in the line item &#145;other
    expenses&#146;. If an impairment indication arises, the
    recoverable amount is estimated and an impairment loss is
    recognised to the extent that the recoverable amount is lower
    than the carrying amount.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Goodwill</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    After initial recognition, goodwill acquired in a business
    combination is measured at cost less any accumulated impairment
    losses. Goodwill is not amortised but is subject to impairment
    testing on an annual basis or whenever there is an indication of
    impairment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(c)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Impairment
    tests for goodwill</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Goodwill acquired through business combinations was originally
    allocated to two cash-generating units for impairment testing,
    being Landmark Financial Services and Landmark Rural Services.
    Due to the sale of the Landmark loan and deposit books during
    the year, goodwill is now allocated to one cash-generating unit,
    being Landmark.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The recoverable amount of the Landmark Rural Services unit has
    been determined by a value in use calculation using 10&#160;year
    cash flow projections based on:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Financial forecasts approved by management for the first
    3&#160;years;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Sales growth of 2.5% with constant margins for the remainder of
    the forecast period (cash flows were extrapolated using a 3.31%
    per annum growth rate in 2009);
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    A terminal value based on a long term growth rate of 2.5% which
    is in line with the long term expected Australian CPI growth.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The post tax nominal discount rate applied to the cash flows is
    10.75%. (The 2009 impairment test used a pre-tax real discount
    rate of 9.91%).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(d)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Key
    assumptions used in the value in use calculations for the
    Landmark Cash-generating unit for 30&#160;September 2010 and
    2009.</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The calculation of value in use is most sensitive to the
    following assumptions:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    EBITDA margins
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Discount rate
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The growth rate used to extrapolate cash flows beyond the
    initial 3&#160;year forecast period
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Sensitivity
    to changes in assumptions</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    With regard to the assessment of the value in use it would
    require an increase of approximately 87&#160;basis points in the
    discount rate, while holding other assumptions unchanged before
    impairment would occur.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

    A-46

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Reconciliations</FONT></I></B>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group has purchased plant and equipment on finance lease
    during the year. This leased equipment is pledged as security
    for the related finance lease liabilities (refer note&#160;16a
    and note&#160;30). At 30&#160;September 2010 the value of leased
    plant and equipment was $1.8m (2009 : Nil)
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The carrying amount of the Group&#146;s borrowings approximates
    their fair value, as they are all variable rate borrowings.
    Amounts which are due beyond 12&#160;months are disclosed via
    contractual maturity analysis in Note&#160;33, including
    comparative data.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <BR>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Future obligations under finance leases and hire purchase
    contracts are included under Note&#160;30.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

    A-49

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <B>650,374</B>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 2pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 12%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>    (1)&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">    The $100&#160;million Multi-currency Revolving Credit Facility
    is a syndicated general corporate purpose loan facility provided
    by four banks to AWB Commercial Funding (AWBCF). During the year
    this facility was reduced from $150&#160;million to
    $100&#160;million and matures in October 2011.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>    (2)&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">    Inventory Financing Facility are seasonal commodity financing
    facilities for the AWB Australia and AWB Harvest Finance Pooling
    operations. Facility Limits quoted are based on the maximum
    funding value obtainable under each facility agreement.<BR>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">During 2010, AWB Australia had
    access to net inventory finance facilities of $239&#160;million
    of which $194&#160;million remained as at 30&#160;September 2010
    and these lines will mature in November and December 2010. AWB
    Australia has received credit approved offers for the 2010/11
    seasonal facilities totalling $550&#160;million.<BR>
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">AWB Harvest Finance has received
    credit approved offers for the 2010/11 seasonal facilities
    totalling $775&#160;million. These offers are currently in the
    process of being negotiated.
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>    (3)&#160;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The $250&#160;million Receivables Securitisation facility forms
    part of the funding for the working capital requirements of
    AWB&#146;s domestic operations. This is an annual renewable
    facility which has been created for the purposes of securitising
    Landmark Rural Services&#146; receivables. This facility has
    been recently extended until January 2012 with credit approval
    to increase the facility limit to $300&#160;million in January
    2011.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">2009</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    Financial Services</FONT></U>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Restructure</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The current year restructuring provision has been raised in
    relation to the Landmark operations. The restructure is expected
    to be completed within 12&#160;months.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Unearned income relates to sales proceeds received in advance of
    delivery of goods.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 2pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 12%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>    (*)&#160;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    On 23&#160;September 2009 AWB launched a fully underwritten 1:1
    accelerated non-renounceable pro rata entitlement offer and a
    $100&#160;million institutional placement to raise
    $459&#160;million.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The offer was at a fixed price of $1.00 per share and the
    following funds were received post year end:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Settlement of the institutional placement and the institutional
    entitlement offer occurred on 7&#160;October 2009, raising a
    total of $218&#160;million
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Settlement of the retail entitlement offer occurred on
    29&#160;October 2009, raising a total of $241&#160;million.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The capital raising was undertaken to reduce debt, strengthen
    the balance sheet and provide financial flexibility for future
    intitiatives.
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-53

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Nature
    and purpose of reserves</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Underwriting
    loss reserve
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The underwriting loss reserve was established to set aside a
    portion of retained profits in recognition of the underwriting
    risk contained within certain financial products offered by AWB.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Foreign
    currency translation reserve
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The foreign currency translation reserve is used to record
    exchange differences arising from the translation of the
    financial statements and results of foreign subsidiaries, joint
    ventures and associates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Legal reserve
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    According to the Swiss Federal Code of Obligations and the AWB
    (Geneva) SA&#146;s articles of incorporation, 5% of the net
    profit of each year is to be appropriated to the general legal
    reserve until this is equivalent to 20% of the Company&#146;s
    share capital. In addition, an amount equal to 10% of such part
    of any dividend, which may be declared or paid in excess of a 5%
    dividend, is required to be transferred to the general legal
    reserve. The general legal reserve up to 50% of the share
    capital is not available for distribution.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Share plan
    reserve
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The share plan reserve is used to record the cost of
    equity-settled transactions over the period in which performance
    conditions are fulfilled in relation to the Performance Rights
    Plan and the Employee Share Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times"><FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Available-for-sale</FONT>
    revaluation reserve
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Gains or losses arising on the revaluation of
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">available-for-sale</FONT>
    assets are recorded in the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">available-for-sale</FONT>
    revaluation reserve.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Acquisition
    of remaining interest in subsidiaries reserve
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This reserve records the excess or discount of consideration
    paid over or under the carrying amount of the remaining shares
    acquired in controlled entities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

    <TD>

<A name='123'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">23.&#160;NON-CONTROLLING
    INTEREST</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->

<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #CCEEFF">
<TD align="left" valign="bottom">
<DIV style="text-indent: -8pt; margin-left: 8pt">
    Minority interest in controlled entities comprises:
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    AWB Limited has entered into an unconditional and irrevocable
    guarantee for the due and punctual payment of amounts payable to
    the creditors of AWB Commercial Funding Limited (wholly owned
    subsidiary).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    AWB Limited did not have any expenditure commitments at
    30&#160;September 2010. Refer to Note&#160;30 for information
    relating to contingent liabilities.
</DIV>

<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-55
<!-- XBRL,n -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">26.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='126'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">KEY
    MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL DISCLOSURES</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <I>Note:</I>&#160;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Key management personnel compensation will not reconcile to
    total amounts within the Remuneration Report, as the
    Remuneration Report includes amounts paid to executives who
    received the highest remuneration during the year (as required
    by the Corporations Act 2001)&#160;in addition to key management
    personnel as defined by AASB 124. Information in this note
    includes payments made to key management personnel in accordance
    with AASB 124 only.
</TD>
</TR>

    holdings</FONT></I>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The number of shares in the company held during the financial
    year by each director of AWB Limited and other key management
    personnel of the Group, including their personally related
    parties, are set out below.

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-57

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(e)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Loans
    to key management personnel</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Details of loans made to directors of AWB Limited and other key
    management personnel of the Group, including their personally
    related parties, are set out below.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For all loans to directors, interest is payable at prevailing
    commercial interest rates. The terms are no more favourable than
    those available to other suppliers and customers.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(f)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Other
    transactions with key management personnel</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A number of directors and other key management personnel, or
    their personally related entities, hold positions in other
    entities that result in them having control or significant
    influence over the financial or operating policies of those
    entities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    These entities transacted with the company or its subsidiaries
    in the reporting period. The terms and conditions of those
    transactions were no more favourable than those available, or
    which might reasonably be expected to be available, on similar
    transactions to unrelated entities on an arm&#146;s length basis.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The aggregate amounts recognised in respect of the following
    types of transactions during the year with directors and other
    key management personnel and their personally related entities,
    were as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Other
    transactions with the company or its controlled
    entities</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="39%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="13%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="34%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=lead -->
    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=hang1 -->

    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=05 type=lead -->
    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=05 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=05 type=hang1 -->

    <B>Transaction</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="3" align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Specified directors/other key management personnel</B>
</TD>

    <B>2010</B>
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">

    From time to time, key management personnel of the company or
    its controlled entities, or their personally related entities,
    may purchase goods from the Group. These purchases are on terms
    and conditions no more favourable than those entered into by
    unrelated customers and are trivial or domestic in nature.

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-58

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    Equity Method) are set out in Note&#160;11.

    <TD>

    with related parties</FONT></I></B>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Terms and
    conditions</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Interest is charged or credited on amounts with AWB Limited at
    prevailing commercial interest rates. All other transactions
    within the Group are based on actual amounts incurred or
    received and are conducted on commercial terms and conditions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    No provision has been raised in relation to any outstanding
    balances, and no expense has been recognised in respect of bad
    or doubtful debts due from related parties.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(f)&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Related
    party transactions with director related entities</FONT></I></B>
</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Terms and
    conditions</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    All transactions within Director related entities are based on
    actual amounts incurred or received and are conducted on
    commercial terms and conditions.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">29.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='129'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SEGMENT
    INFORMATION</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group&#146;s primary segment reporting format is business
    segments as the Group&#146;s risks and rates of return are
    affected predominantly by differences in the products and
    services produced. Secondary segment information is reported
    geographically.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Inter segment pricing is determined on an arm&#146;s length
    basis. Segment results, assets and liabilities include items
    directly attributable to a segment as well as those that can be
    allocated on a reasonable basis. Segment capital expenditure is
    the total cost incurred during the period to acquire segment
    assets that are expected to be used for more than one period.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

    A-59

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    segments</FONT></I></B>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-61

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Differences between the segment allocation to discontinued
    operations as reviewed by management and the statutory
    discontinued operations as disclosed in note&#160;4 are due to
    the following:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The International Commodity Management segment presents the
    result at budgeted rate with the difference between the budgeted
    FX rate and the actual rate reflected in the Other/corporate
    segment.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The LFS discontinued business segment in the segment note
    includes an internal allocation of working capital interest and
    overhead costs which are not included in the discontinued
    operations for statutory reporting purposes.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    These lease commitments represent future minimum lease payments
    due for the head office, regional and overseas offices, motor
    vehicles and forklifts under operating leases. The head office
    lease is for 12&#160;years which commenced in the 2004 financial
    year. The remaining operating leases have an average lease term
    of three years. Lease payments comprise a base amount plus an
    incremental contingent rental. Contingent rentals are based on
    the contract terms.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-62

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group has finance leases and hire purchase contracts for
    plant and equipment with a carrying amount of $1.8m (2009: Nil)
    for both the Group and AWB Limited. These lease contracts expire
    in 5&#160;years. These assets will be owned by the group at the
    end of the lease.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The likely timing or potential reimbursement of these outflows
    is unknown.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Indemnities</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The parent entity had contingent liabilities at
    30&#160;September 2010 in respect of indemnities given by the
    AWB Limited to AWB (International) Limited against possible
    costs incurred by AWB (International) Limited arising in
    relation to proceedings under the Oil for Food Inquiry and any
    possible tax assessments issued against AWB (International)
    Limited by the ATO. This indemnity may give rise to liabilities
    in the parent entity in the event that AWB (International)
    Limited incurs an indemnified liability. Any possible
    liabilities cannot be quantified at the date of this report.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>

    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">32.&#160;</FONT></B>

    <TD>
    <A name='132'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SHARE-BASED

<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Performance
    Rights Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A Performance Rights Plan exists, whereby selected senior
    employees (including key management personnel) of the group are
    given the opportunity to acquire rights over unissued ordinary
    shares in AWB Limited by participating in the plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The terms and valuation of performance rights granted are
    consistent with those granted to key management personnel and
    disclosed within the Remuneration Report.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As the exercise price is $1 for the exercise of large parcels of
    performance rights, combined with certain tranches which have a
    nil exercise price, the effective weighted average exercise
    price is nil.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Weighted
    average remaining contractual life</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The weighted average remaining contractual life for
    equity-settled performance rights outstanding as at
    30&#160;September 2010 is 4.47&#160;years (2009:
    3.25&#160;years).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The weighted average remaining contractual life for cash-settled
    performance rights outstanding as at 30&#160;September 2010 is
    0.38&#160;years (2009: 1.04&#160;years).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As a result of the proposed acquisition of AWB by Agrium, the
    AWB Board exercised its discretion to determine that all
    performance rights become vested on 7&#160;October 2010 (the
    date the Court ordered AWB to convene and hold a Scheme
    Meeting). All performance rights were subsequently exercised.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Range
    of exercise price</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The range of exercise prices for performance rights outstanding
    at the end of the year was $nil to $1 (2009: $nil to $1).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Weighted
    average fair value</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The weighted average fair value of cash-settled performance
    rights granted during the year was $1.06 (2009 $0.93). The
    weighted average fair value of equity-settled performance rights
    granted during the year was $1.08 (2009 $2.09).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Recognised
    cash settled share based payment liability</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The carrying amount of the liability relating to the cash
    settled share based payment at 30&#160;September 2010 is
    $855,160 (2009: $376,597).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    No cash-settled awards vested during the period ended
    30&#160;September 2010 (2009: nil).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Option
    pricing model</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The equity and cash settled rights have been valued using market
    data as at the grant date. A Monte Carlo simulation based
    valuation model was developed to simulate the date of vesting,
    the percentage vesting, the share price and its associated TSR.
    Once the simulated date of vesting and share prices were
    determined, the fair value obtained at each vesting date was
    discounted back to the grant date. Refer to the Remuneration
    Report for a listing of inputs to the valuation model.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">33.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='133'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">FINANCIAL
    RISK MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES AND POLICIES</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This note presents information about the Company&#146;s and
    Group&#146;s exposure to each of the risk factors set out below
    and the Group&#146;s related objectives, policies and processes
    for measuring and managing these risks. The 2010 exposures
    exclude discontinued operations. 2009 has not been restated.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 1%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Financial
    risk factors</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Due to the diversity of its business in Australia and abroad,
    AWB is exposed to risk from a variety of activities such as:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The purchase and sale of commodities, including the chartering
    of ships to manage actual and anticipated transport commitments;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Hedging and proprietary trading in commodity products and
    related derivative instruments; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Foreign exchange and interest rate risk associated with
    commodity trading, the provision of financial services and Group
    funding.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group&#146;s risk appetite is reviewed annually by the
    management team and is approved by the Board of Directors
    (&#145;the Board&#146;).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Board has overall responsibility for the establishment and
    oversight of the risk management framework. The Board has
    established the Board Risk Committee (BRC), which is responsible
    for developing and monitoring risk management policies. The BRC
    reports regularly to the Board on its activities. The BRC
    monitors AWB&#146;s risk management profile principally via the
    Risk Report.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group&#146;s risk management program focuses on the
    unpredictability of financial markets and seeks to minimise
    potential adverse effects on the financial performance of the
    Group. The Group uses derivative financial instruments to
    economically hedge certain risk exposures.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-64

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Derivatives are used to manage foreign currency, commodity,
    freight and interest rate exposures. Group Treasury and the
    divisions may only deal in authorised markets, exchanges,
    products and instruments. Limits on the size and nature of
    transactions permitted have been established by the BRC and are
    subject to strict internal controls. Changes to limits must be
    approved by the risk function.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Markets,
    products and instruments</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Approved markets, exchanges and products are defined in the
    Group&#146;s risk management policy. All authorised products and
    instruments are listed in a register of approved products and
    instruments maintained by the risk function. Before entering
    into any contract, the authority to act is verified. All new
    products must be approved by the risk function and notified to
    the BRC. When significant new product approvals are sought (or
    significant changes to existing products), the risk function
    consults with the BRC prior to approving.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    AWB uses a combination of limits and operational thresholds to
    ensure that exposures remain within acceptable limits.
    Operational thresholds are found in the register of limits and
    authorisations and they are approved by the Managing Director in
    consultation with the Management Risk Committee.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    AWB&#146;s business and operating environment requires
    management to undertake a broad variety of trading, particularly
    in relation to commodities, in addition, a strictly controlled
    amount of strategic proprietary trading is undertaken.
    Controlled proprietary trading is undertaken in accordance with
    the risk management policy which includes strict levels of
    authorisation and control which are monitored by the risk
    function and Group Treasury.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The accounting classifications of each category of financial
    instruments, and their carrying amounts are set out below.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>

    &#151;
</TD>
