<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Interest
    Rate Risk</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Interest rate risk refers to the risk that the value of a
    financial instrument or cash flows associated with the
    instruments will fluctuate due to changes in market interest
    rates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Group
    Exposure</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group has a net exposure to interest rate risk through the
    combination of its interest bearing assets and liabilities. The
    main assets of the Group impacted by movements in interest rates
    are the Landmark Financial Services loan book, which lends funds
    on both a fixed and variable interest rate
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-65

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">basis and the Harvest Finance
    products. The Harvest Finance loan products are provided on a
    floating interest rate basis whilst the Harvest Finance payment
    products are provided on a fixed interest rate basis.
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Landmark Financial Services and Harvest Finance loan books
    are funded on a floating rate basis. The working capital
    requirements for the Group are funded via the Syndicated Loan
    Facility, inventory financing and securitisation of the Landmark
    Rural Services receivables, all of which are exposed to floating
    interest rates, and Unsecured Deposit Notes (UDNs). Offshore
    subsidiaries utilise letter of credit and bank facilities to
    fund their working capital, all of which are exposed to floating
    rates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Group Treasury will at times enter into derivative interest rate
    products such as exchange-traded and
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">over-the-counter</FONT>
    options, forward rate agreements and interest rate swaps for
    proprietary purposes within the Board delegated limits. Such
    transactions create interest rate risk for the Group.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Management
    of exposure</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Group Treasury actively manages the Group&#146;s interest rate
    exposure by monitoring interest rate markets and quantifying the
    risk for predetermined outlook periods. When appropriate, the
    Group will enter into hedges to reposition its risk. Due to the
    assets being short term in nature or exposed to variable rates,
    the Group&#146;s policy is to be exposed to floating interest
    rates on borrowings to ensure that the assets and liabilities
    are suitably matched. Where there have been loans provided by
    Landmark Financial Services on a fixed interest rate basis,
    these loans will be hedged back to floating interest rates
    utilising interest rate swaps. Such interest rate swaps result
    in the Group exchanging fixed interest rate receipts for
    floating interest rate receipts. Harvest Finance payment
    products are on a fixed interest rate basis and currently there
    are no hedges in place (2009: $55m).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The manner in which the interest rate risk is managed will
    affect the net profit of the group. The interest receipts on the
    fixed rate loan portfolio are swapped to variable, reducing
    fluctuations in fair value movements. The Group&#146;s exposure
    to variable interest rates arises from the excess of financial
    liabilities (borrowings) over financial assets (loans and
    advances), giving rise to a net variable interest rate exposure.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Interest
    rate risk exposure as at balance date</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A 10&#160;basis point movement in interest rates would have a
    $0.4&#160;million impact on post-tax profit/(loss) (2009:
    $0.3&#160;million). The table below provides an example of the
    impact of a 100&#160;basis point increase (2009: 200&#160;basis
    point increase) or a 50&#160;basis point decrease (2009:
    50&#160;basis point decrease) to the post tax profit and loss as
    at balance date. Other than retained earnings, there would be no
    impact on equity.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->

    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="2%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="2%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->

    $&#146;000

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Fair value exposure also arises on the fixed rate loan book and
    related interest rate derivatives. The net effect of these is
    included in the sensitivity analysis above.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Discussion
    of sensitivity analysis</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This analysis assumes that all other variables will remain
    constant, in particular credit margins on assets and liabilities
    as well as foreign exchange rates. The balances depicted in the
    table above will not remain constant throughout the 2011
    financial year, and therefore should be used with care.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The results of the above sensitivity analysis are within the
    risk appetite of the Group, and are a result of external debt
    exposure being subject to variable interest rates. The exposure
    is caused by the working capital requirements of the Group which
    is a required risk of operating.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Foreign
    currency exchange risk</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Foreign currency risk (or foreign exchange risk) arises on
    financial instruments that are denominated in a foreign
    currency, i.e. in a currency other than the functional currency
    in which they are measured. Currency risk does not arise from
    financial instruments that are non-monetary items.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    There are two types of currency risk&#160;&#151; transaction
    risk and translation risk. Transaction risk arises when the
    Group enters into transactions that will be settled in the
    future in foreign currency. Translation risk is the risk that
    arises when the Group has assets and liabilities denominated in
    a foreign currency, whose carrying amounts will fluctuate with
    movements in foreign currency exchange rates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Group
    exposure</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group&#146;s shareholders&#146; equity, earnings and cash
    flows are influenced by a wide variety of currencies due to the
    geographic diversity of the Group&#146;s sales and the countries
    in which it operates. Transaction risk arises from various
    activities of the Group. Such activities include the majority of
    physical as well as hedging contracts of wheat and other grains
    being denominated in USD whilst shipping contracts are also
    priced in USD. Offshore subsidiaries will at various points in
    time pay dividends to the parent which will create transaction
    risk as the dividends will be denominated in the
    subsidiaries&#146; transactional currency which is generally
    USD. From time to time, the Group will have small foreign
    currency transactions which relate to purchases of supplies in
    foreign currencies.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-66

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The functional currency of the Group&#146;s Australian
    operations is AUD. The functional currencies of the Group&#146;s
    international subsidiaries is predominantly USD as the majority
    of revenues, operating costs and debt are denominated in USD.
    Therefore translation risk arises when the international
    subsidiaries&#146; accounts are translated into AUD for
    reporting purposes.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Group Treasury will at times enter into derivative foreign
    exchange products such as currency options, cross currency
    contracts (spot and forward) and currency swaps for proprietary
    purposes within the Board delegated limits. Such transactions
    create foreign exchange risk for the Group.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Management
    of Exposure</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Group Treasury actively manages the foreign exchange risk for
    the Group by monitoring the foreign exchange markets and where
    appropriate entering into hedges. Hedging instruments include
    cross-currency contracts (spot and forward), currency swaps and
    currency options.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    It is the Group&#146;s policy to hedge the majority of
    transactional exposures to foreign currencies arising from
    forward sale and purchase commodity contracts. These commodity
    contracts are entered into by the Group to manage against
    commodity price risk that arises as a result of commodity prices
    being denominated and at expiry, being settled in foreign
    currencies. Business units are required to identify their
    transactional exposures and notify Group Treasury which will
    then enter into the appropriate hedge.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Translation exposures arising from translating offshore
    subsidiaries into AUD for reporting purposes are not hedged.
    However, should an offshore subsidiary pay a dividend to the
    parent, the foreign currency transaction will usually be hedged
    at the point in time the dividend is declared.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Foreign
    currency exposure/sensitivity analysis as at balance
    date</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A 1 cent movement in the AUD against the USD would have a
    $0.2&#160;million impact on post tax profit/(loss) (2009:
    $0.1&#160;million) and on net monetary assets/(liabilities)
    excluding hedging of future commodity purchases and sales.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As discussed above, the Group manages its exposure to commodity
    prices by taking out forward purchases and sale commodity
    contracts. These forward purchase and sale commodity contracts
    are settled in foreign currency and therefore result in the
    Group being exposed to foreign currency
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-67

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">risk. To mitigate the risk arising
    from future foreign currency cash flows, the Group enters into
    foreign exchange contracts (FECs) and currency options. At
    30&#160;September 2010, the Group&#146;s exposure arising from
    open FECs and currency options is as follows:
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The impact to profit and loss as disclosed in the sensitivity on
    the FECs and currency options (on the previous page) will be
    over 85% (2009: 90%) offset by the future net receipt of foreign
    currency proceeds on settlement of the forward sale and purchase
    contracts. This is depicted by the following analysis of
    notional values of the FECs and the gross cash flows expected
    from the forward purchase and sale contracts.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-68

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Management through its specialised treasury function actively
    monitors foreign currency positions held by the Group to ensure
    that no material exposure to foreign currency outside of
    economic relationships arises.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The analysis above does not include translation of foreign
    subsidaries and, as the Group does not enter into cash flow
    hedges, the sensitivity analysis does not result in an impact on
    equity reserves. The balances in the tables above will not
    remain constant throughout the 2011 financial year, and
    therefore should be used with care.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Commodity
    price risk</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Commodity price risk arises from the potential impact of changes
    in commodity prices on the value of a transaction. It may
    include:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The impact of holding positions that are exposed to price
    changes;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The risk of loss because a position cannot be liquidated without
    incurring significant losses compared to fair market value; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The risk of loss from incorrect valuation or pricing of
    unfavourable terms and conditions in a contract.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Group
    exposure</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Commodity prices can fluctuate widely in response to changing
    levels of supply and demand. This is a natural risk of the
    Group&#146;s business model and is managed by trading in a wide
    variety of physical and derivative products on a number of
    different markets and exchanges. AWB is exposed to commodity
    price risk from a variety of activities including:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The purchase and sale of commodities;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Chartering of ships to manage actual and anticipated transport
    commitments; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Hedging of the above activities.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Management
    of exposure</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Each trading business unit actively manages commodity price risk
    exposure by monitoring commodity markets and outlooks as well as
    commodity positions to which it is exposed. When appropriate,
    the Group will enter into hedges (futures and options) to
    reposition its risk while ensuring that derivative positions are
    not of a magnitude that can make it difficult to liquidate
    within a reasonable time period.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group&#146;s commodity risk management framework includes
    value at risk (VAR) limits for exposures to commodities by
    region which are documented in the Register of Limits. These
    limits are designed to allow business decisions to be made with
    integrity while protecting AWB&#146;s reputation and competitive
    position. The corporate risk unit independently monitor the
    limits discussed above to ensure commodity exposures remain
    within the Group&#146;s risk appetite.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    At balance date the group had the following physical and
    derivative positions related to exposures to commodity price
    risk and the impact of a 10% change in commodity prices would
    increase/(decrease) the profit and loss by the amounts shown
    below. Other than retained earnings, there would be no impact on
    equity as a result of shift in commodity prices.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Commodity
    price risk exposure/sensitivity analysis at balance
    date</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="12%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-69

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I></B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times"><I>Discussion
    of sensitivity analysis</I>
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A 10% movement in commodity prices has been determined as a
    reasonably possible change based on recent market history
    specific to agricultural commodities. However, due to controls
    the Group has in relation to commodity trading, such as trading
    limits and stop losses, it is not expected that a change of this
    magnitude would crystallise. The fair value exposure on
    derivatives and physical inventory above includes inventory held
    in a broker-trader relationship (because it is integral to the
    profile of the commodity risk), the associated forward sales
    agreements are included in the derivative financial instrument
    exposures.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Commonly traded commodities include wheat, soy beans, soy meal,
    soy oil, sorghum, barley, canola, corn, and cattle.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The relationship between commodity prices and foreign currencies
    is complex and movement in foreign exchange can impact commodity
    prices. These exposures and related sensitivities are not
    expected to remain constant throughout 2011 and therefore should
    be used with care.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Capital
    management and liquidity risk</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Capital
    Management</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The capital structure of the Group consists of debt, cash and
    cash equivalents and equity attributable to equity holders of
    the parent, comprising issued capital, retained earnings and
    reserves.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group has a capital management strategy which provides
    guidelines for:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Determining the appropriate level of total equity and debt for
    the AWB Limited Group;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Setting appropriate benchmark rates for return on capital for
    the AWB Group, AWB businesses and new investments;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Allocating, measuring and monitoring the level of capital held
    by each AWB business and the return on capital invested;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Prioritising the allocation of capital to new business
    activities;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Ensuring compliance with risk parameters set by the board; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The dividend policy.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The strategy is reviewed by the CFO and is approved by the AWB
    Limited Board.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    AWB has had a stated aim in prior years for a dividend payout of
    between 40% and 65% of its net profit after tax post significant
    items, and the aim of fully franking all dividends. This policy
    is reviewed annually and takes into account industry conditions
    and the AWB group&#146;s overall capital management strategy and
    investment view. Any dividend paid is subject to final approval
    by the Board. Given the changes to the Corporations Act 2001
    regarding the payment of dividends, it is the intention of AWB
    to review its dividend policy and revise it accordingly.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Capital
    restrictions</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In accordance with the Swiss Federal Code of Obligations and AWB
    (Geneva) SA&#146;s articles of incorporation, 5% of the net
    profit of each year is to be apportioned to the general legal
    reserve until this is equivalent to 20% of the Company&#146;s
    share capital. In addition, an amount equal to 10% of such part
    of any dividend, which may be declared or paid in excess of a 5%
    dividend, is required to be transferred to the general reserve.
    The general reserve up to 50% of the share capital is not
    available for distribution. Refer to Note&#160;22 for a
    numerical reconciliation of this reserve.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Liquidity
    risk</FONT></I>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Liquidity risk is the possibility that an entity will be unable
    to meet its obligations as they become due because of an
    inability to liquidate assets or obtain adequate funding.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Group
    exposure
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group is exposed to liquidity risk principally due to:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    its working capital requirements for the Landmark and Commodity
    businesses, including funding and settlement of derivative
    instruments of the Group; and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the funding requirements of Harvest Finance loans and payment
    products.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</FONT></I>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Management
    of exposure
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The primary objective of the Group&#146;s liquidity management
    framework and processes is to ensure that the Group has
    sufficient liquidity to meet its obligations as they fall due
    across a variety of operating circumstances. In managing its
    liquidity risk, the Group has access to funding through
    committed and uncommitted bank facilities. Group Treasury
    centrally coordinates the relationships with banks (the Group
    has a panel of relationship banks), the borrowing requirements
    of the Group and the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">day-to-day</FONT>
    cash management.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In managing the Group&#146;s liquidity, cash flow forecasting is
    performed. Cash flow forecasting is largely dominated by the
    cyclical nature of the business and is based on cash flow model
    projections. Group Treasury utilises these cash flow forecasts
    combined with the funding profile to obtain
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-70

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">short-dated and longer-term
    liquidity arrangements which are generally funded through
    external borrowings. Group Treasury ensures that there is a
    diverse range of funding facilities for the Group and has
    structured the maturity dates to ensure that facility maturities
    are not unduly concentrated.
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group has multiple funding facilities, each of which are
    used to fund certain areas of the business. Working capital for
    the Group is provided in various forms, including a syndicated
    loan facility, inventory financing and discounting of
    receivables. The syndicated loan facility is provided by four
    major banks. Discounting of the Landmark Rural Services
    receivables provides funding to the Group as receivables are
    sold to a financing special purpose vehicle (RURAL Trade
    Receivables Trust) at a discounted rate upon creation of the
    receivable. The trust is funded by way of a bank warehouse
    facility. Offshore subsidiaries are typically capitalised to a
    sufficient level to allow them to obtain bank facilities to fund
    their working capital requirements as and when they are required.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Harvest Finance loan and payment products are funded via
    inventory financing.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In order to maintain access to the global capital markets, the
    Group has sought and maintains a short and long term credit
    rating for AWB Harvest Finance from the global credit rating
    agency Standard and Poor&#146;s of A1 short term and A long term
    (credit watch negative). A long term credit rating is also
    obtained for AWB Limited from Standard and Poor&#146;s which is
    currently BBB- (credit watch positive).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Maturity profiles of funding facilities are outlined in
    Note&#160;16(b).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The table below analyses the Group&#146;s financial liabilities
    across the defined maturity groupings based on the remaining
    period at the reporting date to the earliest contractual
    maturity date.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Contractual
    maturities non-derivative financial liabilities</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <TD width="45%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="6%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="6%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As the amounts in the tables above are the contractual
    undiscounted cash flows, some balances will not agree with the
    amounts presented in the Balance Sheet. The above disclosure
    reflects maturities as at 30&#160;September and does not take
    into account facility extensions post year end as disclosed in
    Note&#160;16(b)
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group manages liquidity risk associated with derivative
    contracts on a portfolio basis, combining commodity sale and
    purchase contracts with financially settled derivative assets
    and liabilities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The table below represents the cash inflows and outflows of the
    derivative instrument portfolio held by the Group as at balance
    date.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Contractual
    maturities on derivative instruments</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-71

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Discussion
    of maturity analysis</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Expected net inflows and outflows have been calculated using
    spot rates as at balance date and reflect gross and net settled
    positions where applicable. The maturity analysis includes
    contractual cash flows on both derivative assets and derivative
    liabilities. Contracted cash outflows are not expected to equate
    to actual cash flows as the group utilises inventory and other
    financing facilities whereby title to inventory passes to the
    financier as security for the funding.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Credit
    risk</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Credit risk is the risk of loss caused by another party not
    fulfilling its obligations, including:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The risk that a customer or counterparty that has been provided
    with a product or service is unable or unwilling to meet its
    obligations;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The risk that a party reneges on a forward contract prior to the
    due date or delivery date without settling the price
    differential.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Group
    exposure</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group is exposed to credit risk in the form of:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    loans to customers for the purchase of farm assets including
    land, crops and livestock;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    short term commercial trading accounts for customer purchases of
    farm supplies;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    amounts owing for grain trading and derivative financial
    instruments over commodities;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    exposures to financial institutions.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Management
    of exposure</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Credit risk is overseen by a Credit Risk Management Committee
    (&#145;the Committee&#146;). The committee has authority to
    approve transactions, review credit policy, consider emerging
    risks and adjust credit risk appetite.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The credit risk control system includes:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Risk assessment and measurement tools at the counterparty level;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Regular reporting on credit quality for all portfolios and
    products;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    A system of delegated approval authorities based on the
    experience and training of the personnel concerned;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Determination of an impairment allowance that represents an
    estimate of incurred losses in respect of loans and receivables.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(a)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Loan credit
    risk
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Exposure to loan credit risk is managed through regular analysis
    of the ability of credit customers and borrowers to repay
    principal and interest in a timely manner, and by changing
    lending limits where appropriate as the risk profile changes.
    Exposure to credit risk is also managed by obtaining collateral
    and corporate and personal guarantees.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The ability to repay is assessed and risk rated for individual
    customers and for a portfolio of customers. An independent
    credit team is responsible for assessing credit information,
    determining the risk rating for customers, providing approval
    for limits and for structuring a transaction that provides an
    acceptable risk profile. Customer risk rating profiles and
    portfolio risk are reviewed regularly. Where collateral is
    taken, the type and valuation of collateral is reviewed by
    credit personnel, and policies for types of acceptable security
    are set.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    When a customer loan becomes impaired; it is put under the
    control of specialist staff who work with the business unit and
    customer to analyse the issues, determine a collection strategy
    and, if necessary, manage recourse to collateral.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As at 30&#160;September 2010, the Group did not have any
    customer loans outstanding. The customer loans held in the prior
    year related to the Landmark Financial services and deposit
    books which was sold during March 2010. As a result the Group is
    not exposed to any Loan credit risk as at 30&#160;September 2010
    (2009:$382.5 million).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(b)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Commercial
    trading accounts
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The ability and willingness to repay are assessed on major
    customer accounts in this portfolio in a similar way as for
    customer loans. However, there is also a large volume of small
    commercial trading accounts which are assessed, rated and
    controlled on a portfolio basis. Typically, collateral is not
    taken on the trading account portfolio, as exposures are smaller
    than for customer loans and are generally for periods of between
    7 and 30&#160;days.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(c)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Accounts for
    grain trading and derivative contracts
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Counterparties in the trading environment are evaluated for
    credit worthiness as for other portfolios. Open contracts are
    revalued regularly and the capacity to repay contracts at
    today&#146;s market values is assessed. Given the shorter term
    nature of the obligations, collateral is taken only selectively
    and includes retaining ownership to grain under shipment and
    letters of credit.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-72

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(d)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Financial
    institution credit risk
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Group Treasury establishes, reviews and monitors bank and
    financial institution counterparty credit limits, within
    Board-approved guidelines. A predetermined matrix exists for the
    approval of counterparty credit limits by the Credit Risk
    Committee. The size of the credit limit approved is dependent on
    the rating given by either Standard and Poor&#146;s
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Moody&#146;s, and in certain circumstances will be limited by a
    maximum percentage of the counterparty&#146;s shareholder&#146;s
    funds <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    its total assets. Limits exceeding guidelines require Board
    approval. All counterparty credit ratings are required to be
    reviewed at least once a year. Group Treasury is required to
    manage its derivative dealings within certain credit limits and
    to administer and manage exposures to ensure that no excessive
    exposures occur.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Management
    of concentration of risk</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Concentration of risk is managed at a portfolio level, each
    month through quality reviews and delinquency and loss reviews.
    The Group minimises its concentration of credit risk by
    undertaking transactions with a large number of customers. The
    Group is not materially exposed to any individual overseas
    country or individual customer.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Credit
    quality of financial assets that are neither past due nor
    impaired</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Specific and collective provisions for impairment exist for all
    loans and advances including trade receivables for balances
    known or anticipated to be uncollectible. The risk grading and
    monitoring systems of the Group are such that credit exposures
    which are not provided for by an impairment provision are
    considered to be of high credit quality. Further, the average
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">loan-to-value</FONT>
    ratio of the rural loans and advances portfolio is Nil (2009:
    39%) as a result of the sale of the Landmark financial services
    and deposit book during the year.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 7%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group has cash, short term deposits and certain derivative
    contracts with financial institution counterparties. Via the use
    of limits outlined above, as well as the high credit ratings of
    financial institution counterparties, management assess the
    credit quality of these financial assets to be sound. Due to the
    short term nature of the trading accounts, combined with the
    credit assessment process, with the exception of those trade
    receivables provided for by a specific provision, the credit
    quality of these financial assets is considered to be sound.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Equity
    price risk</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group holds equity investments that are classified as
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">available-for-sale</FONT>
    financial assets and are initially measured at fair value with
    subsequent changes in fair value recognised directly in equity.
    On disposal, accumulated fair value changes are recycled to the
    income statement. These investments primarily relate to shares
    and a membership held in the Chicago Mercantile Exchange and a
    membership held with the Kansas City Board of Trade. As at
    30&#160;September 2010, it is estimated that a change of 10% in
    equity prices would result in a charge or credit to consolidated
    equity of $0.2m (2009: 0.4m).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Fair
    Value Hierarchy</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group uses various methods in estimating the fair value of a
    financial instruments. The methods comprise:-
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Level&#160;1: the fair value is calculated using quoted
    prices(unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or
    liabilities
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Level&#160;2: the fair value is estimated using inputs other
    than quoted prices included within level&#160;1 that are
    observable for the asset or liability, either directly (i.e., as
    prices) or indirectly (i.e., derived from prices)
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Level&#160;3: the fair value is estimated using inputs for the
    asset or liability that are not based on observable market data
    (unobservable inputs).
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The fair value of the financial instruments as well as the
    methods used to estimate the fair values are summarised in the
    table below:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="80%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="3%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="3%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=lead -->
