<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The group has forward sales agreements relating to inventory
    located in the Ukraine. These agreements have been valued using
    a price sourced from the Ukraine however, as this is not
    considered to be an active market, these have been classified as
    Level&#160;3.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The amount recognised in the income statement for the year ended
    30&#160;September 2010 relating to these instruments was $2,017k
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As at 30&#160;September 2010, it is estimated that a change of
    10% in the price would result in a charge or credit to
    consolidated equity of $0.7m after tax.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-73
<!-- XBRL,N -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">34.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='134'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DERIVATIVE
    INSTRUMENTS AND FIXED RATE LOAN FAIR VALUE MOVEMENTS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Derivatives
    held for trading</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group holds a variety of derivatives. As hedge accounting is
    not applied, all derivative contracts are classified as held for
    trading and are recognised at fair value with changes recognised
    in the income statement as required by AASB 139.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The fair value of derivative positions held at 30&#160;September
    2010 is as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Net gains/(losses) taken to profit and loss during the financial
    year for derivative assets and liabilities classified as held
    for trading was $(61,253)&#160;million (2009:
    $90,043&#160;million).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Landmark financial services and deposit book was sold during
    the year. As a result there are no outstanding fixed rate loans
    as at 30&#160;September 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The effect of changes in fair value on fixed rate loans are
    largely offset by interest rate swaps. In the prior year,
    interest rate swaps produced a $6.2&#160;million loss.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">35.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='135'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DEED
    OF CROSS GUARANTEE</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Pursuant to ASIC Class&#160;Order 98/1418 (as amended) dated
    13&#160;August 1998, the following wholly-owned subsidiaries are
    relieved from the Corporations Act 2001 requirements to:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    prepare a financial report and directors&#146; report;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    have the financial report audited;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    distribute the financial report, directors&#146; report or
    auditors&#146; report, or have them laid before an annual
    general meeting;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    lodge the reports with ASIC;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    appoint an auditor for a public company.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    It is a condition of the Class&#160;Order that each of the
    companies listed below enter into a Deed of Cross Guarantee. The
    effect of the Deed is that each of these companies guarantees to
    pay any deficiency in the event of the winding up of any other
    of these companies.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The subsidiaries that are parties to the Deed are:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">36.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='136'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">CONTROLLED
    ENTITIES</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The consolidated financial statements incorporate the assets,
    liabilities and results of the following subsidiaries in
    accordance with the accounting policy described in
    note&#160;1(b):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Particulars
    in relation to controlled entities</FONT></I></B>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-77

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">37.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='137'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">INTEREST
    IN JOINTLY CONTROLLED ASSETS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    ACN 089 443 407 Pty Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of AWB
    Limited, holds a 50% (2009: 50%) interest in jointly controlled
    assets; Australian Independent Commodity Handlers (AICH). AICH
    owns a storage and handling facility known as the Melbourne Port
    Terminal. ACN 089 443 407 Pty Ltd does not participate in the
    operation of the facility.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">39.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='139'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SUBSEQUENT
    EVENTS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 20&#160;August 2010, AWB Limited announced that it had
    entered into a scheme implementation agreement with Agrium Inc
    (Agrium)., under which Agrium would acquire all of the issued
    capital of AWB under a scheme of arrangement at a price of
    A$1.50 per share, subject to foreign investment and shareholder
    approval.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-78

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 4&#160;October 2010, AWB Limited announced that it has been
    advised by Agrium Inc. that it has received clearance from the
    Australian Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) in relation to
    the proposed acquisition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 7&#160;October 2010, the Supreme Court of Victoria approved
    the convening of a meeting of AWB shareholders to consider and
    vote on the proposed Scheme of Arrangement. The Scheme booklet
    was released on 8&#160;October 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Scheme Meeting was held on 16&#160;November 2010 with a
    result in favour of the scheme. The acquisition of AWB by Agrium
    is scheduled for completion on 3&#160;December 2010. As a result
    of the resolution to approve the Scheme of Arrangement and the
    potential future change of ownership of the AWB Limited Group,
    the valuation of assets and liabilities will be reassessed
    following final court approval and settlement, including the
    deferred tax assets of the group. This may lead to the potential
    derecognition of certain deferred tax assets arising in respect
    of group tax losses and temporary differences. The financial
    effects if any as a consequence of a vote in favour of the
    Scheme have not been brought into account in this financial
    report.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A fully franked special dividend of 15 cents per share was
    approved by the board on 17&#160;November 2010 and is payable on
    30&#160;November 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Since 30&#160;September 2010, no other matter or circumstance
    has arisen that has significantly affected, or may significantly
    affect:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    (a)&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the consolidated entity&#146;s operations in future financial
    years;&#160;or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    (b)&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the results of those operations in future financial
    years;&#160;or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

</TD>

    the consolidated entity&#146;s state of affairs in future
    financial years.
</TD>

<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">40.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='140'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BUSINESS
    COMBINATIONS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 3&#160;September 2010, Landmark Operations Limited acquired
    the Genfarm business, based in Australia with operations in
    production of agricultural chemicals.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The total cost of the combination was $6,787,566 and comprised
    of the Genfarm&#146;s supplier&#146;s contracts, employees and
    any business processes and intelligence, payment of cash and
    costs directly attributable to the combination.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The acquired operations contributed revenue of $nil and a net
    loss of $255,502 to the Group for the period from
    3&#160;September 2010 to 30&#160;September 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The goodwill is attributed to the ability to expand the
    Group&#146;s trading business and to obtain operating synergies
    expected to arise from the acquisition of the business.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Details of net assets acquired and goodwill are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="92%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="5%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
    <B>Purchase consideration<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">41.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='141'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">MAJOR
    LITIGATION</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Mastafa
    and Ismail claim</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In September 2007, a class action complaint was filed against
    AWB Limited, AWB (USA) Limited and BNP Paribas in the US
    District Court for the Southern District of New York on behalf
    of Saadya Mastafa and Kafia Ismail, allegedly representing a
    class comprising victims (or the surviving immediate family
    members of victims) of crimes allegedly perpetrated by the
    Saddam Hussein regime in Iraq from 1996 to 2003. The complaint
    asserted causes of action under the US Alien Tort Claims Act.
    The damages alleged to have been suffered by the plaintiffs were
    unspecified.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 25&#160;September 2008, the court granted each of the
    defendants&#146; motions to dismiss the complaint. The complaint
    against AWB Limited was dismissed on grounds that Australia was
    the proper forum to hear the complaint. The court ruled that (as
    is standard in the case of such dismissals by the court) if an
    Australian court of last review refuse jurisdiction over any
    action brought in Australia by the plaintiffs, or if AWB does
    not waive any statute of limitations defences available to it,
    the US court will &#145;resume&#146; jurisdiction over the
    plaintiffs&#146; claims. The judge noted that a conditional
    dismissal such as this is standard in this court. The complaint
    against AWB (USA) Limited was dismissed on the grounds of a
    failure to properly plead a claim against it. The court granted
    the plaintiff leave to replead its case against AWB (USA)
    Limited. No such repleading has been filed to date.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Karim
    (Iraqi residents&#146; class action)</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Karim class action was filed against AWB Limited, AWB (USA)
    Limited and BNP Paribas in the US District Court for the
    Southern District of New York on 22&#160;December 2006.
    Commodity Specialists Company (CSC) of New York was subsequently
    joined as a defendant by the Plaintiffs. The plaintiffs are
    stated to be residents of the three northern governorates of
    Iraq.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The complaint (as amended and filed on the 17&#160;June
    2007)&#160;alleges that by reason of AWB&#146;s conduct during
    the OFF Programme, AWB depleted the UN OFF escrow account, and
    thereby unlawfully deprived these plaintiffs and the others in
    the class (all of whom it is alleged are or were residents of
    the three northern governorates of Iraq) of the humanitarian
    benefits which those funds would have purchased for them. It
    also alleges that BNP&#160;Paribas, CSC and AWB engaged in an
    illegal conspiracy. The complaint alleges that these actions
    amounted to violations of the US Racketeer-Influenced and
    Corrupt Organisations (RICO) Act and the plaintiffs are claiming
    treble damages under RICO. No specified amount of damages is
    stated in the amended complaint.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 30&#160;September 2008, all of the defendants&#146; motions
    to dismiss the complaint were granted by the court. On
    22&#160;October 2008 the plaintiffs filed in the US Court of
    Appeals for the Second Circuit a notice of appeal against the
    dismissals. On 2&#160;October 2009 the Court of Appeals affirmed
    the dismissal in AWB&#146;s favour of the plaintiff&#146;s
    action. To date no further steps have been taken by the
    plaintiffs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Iraq
    Government civil lawsuit</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On the 1&#160;July 2008 the Iraqi Government filed a civil
    lawsuit (technically not a class action) in the US District
    Court for the Southern District of New York against AWB and 92
    other companies who participated in the UN OFF Programme,
    including banks, petroleum companies, motor manufacturers,
    pharmaceutical companies, etc., alleging the defendants
    participated in an illegal conspiracy with the &#145;former
    Saddam Hussein regime&#146;, contrary to the US
    Racketeer-Influenced and Corrupt Organisations Act (RICO), to
    divert funds from the UN OFF Programme escrow account. Damages
    alleged against the 89 defendants were US$10.4bn and treble
    damages were claimed under RICO.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    AWB Limited (among others) entered into a stipulation with the
    plaintiffs to allow for the complete service of all defendants
    with an amended complaint, and for the service and hearing of
    two rounds of motions to dismiss. The amended complaint was
    filed on 31&#160;July 2009. On 15&#160;January 2010 the
    defendants filed their first round of Motions to dismiss the
    amended complaint filed by the plaintiff in July 2009. On
    29&#160;April 2010 the plaintiff filed its Opposition to the
    Defendants&#146; Motion to Dismiss. The defendants reply was
    filed on 22&#160;June 2010. A decision in relation to the Motion
    to Dismiss is not expected until at least December 2010.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-80
<!-- XBRL,n -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">42.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='142'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times"><FONT style="white-space: nowrap">OIL-FOR-FOOD</FONT>
    INQUIRY</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Report of the Commission of Inquiry in relation to the
    United Nations
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Oil-for-Food</FONT>
    Programme (Cole Report), tabled in parliament in November 2006,
    found that certain acts and conduct by AWB Limited, AWB
    (International) Limited (AWBI) and certain of their former
    employees and officers, in conjunction with the UN
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Oil-for-Food</FONT>
    Programme for Iraq (OFF Programme), might have breached certain
    provisions of the Criminal Code, Crimes Act 1958 (Vic)&#160;and
    Banking (Foreign Exchange) Regulations 1959. It recommended the
    establishment of a joint task force comprising the Australian
    Federal Police, Victoria Police and the Australian Securities
    and Investments Commission (ASIC) to consider possible
    prosecutions of AWB, AWBI and certain of those individuals. The
    task force recommended by the Cole Report was established in
    December 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In July 2007, ASIC launched its own investigation, and in
    December 2007 ASIC issued civil proceedings in the Supreme Court
    of Victoria against two former Directors and four former
    employees of AWB Limited. In November 2008, the court stayed
    those proceedings, except for those against Mr Andrew Lindberg,
    AWB&#146;s former Managing Director.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 29&#160;August 2009 the Australian Federal Police (AFP)
    confirmed that on the advice of Mr Peter Hastings QC, and in
    consultation with the Commonwealth Director of Public
    Prosecutions and the Australian Government
    Attorney-General&#146;s Department, the AFP had decided to
    discontinue the AFP investigation and to offer assistance to
    ASIC.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The trial against Mr Lindberg commenced on 19&#160;October 2009,
    but has been adjourned due to ongoing interlocutory matters
    between ASIC and Mr&#160;Lindberg in relation to the pleadings.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On 2&#160;June 2010 ASIC confirmed in writing to AWB that it has
    completed its investigation into the affairs of AWB in
    connection with the OFF Programme, and that it is not
    investigating, and does not intend to conduct any further
    investigation of any possible contravention by AWB of any law in
    connection with OFF. Further, ASIC has confirmed that it does
    not intend to pursue criminal proceedings against any person,
    including the six defendants who are currently the subject of
    civil penalty proceedings.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The stay of proceedings in respect of former AWB Chairman Mr
    Trevor Flugge, and former employees Mssrs Geary, Long, Ingleby
    and Stott will now be lifted so that their respective civil
    penalty proceedings can proceed. The lifting of the stays and
    resumption of the proceedings against the five former officers
    will have cost implications for AWB, because of the indemnity
    arrangements in place under settlement agreements and D&#038;O
    deeds. Consequently, AWB is assisting both ASIC and the
    defendants to attempt to reach settlement of the differences
    between them prior to trial, and hence, minimise costs to AWB.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    It is still possible that employees or current directors of AWB
    will be called to be interviewed by ASIC in relation to the six
    proceedings still on foot.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-81
<!-- XBRL,n -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">43.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='143'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">CANADIAN
    GAAP&#160;RECONCILIATIONS</FONT></B>
</TD>

<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">2010</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-82

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Canadian-GAAP
    conversion notes</FONT></U></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(a)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Treatment of
    joint venture entities
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under IAS 31 Interests in Joint Ventures, the Group applies
    equity accounting to its interest in joint venture entities.
    Under Canadian Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
    &#147;C-GAAP&#148;, in particular CICA 3055 Investments in Joint
    Ventures, these joint ventures are proportionately consolidated.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Balance sheet impact&#160;&#151; On application of C-GAAP there
    is a net impact of $22.7m decrease to net assets due to
    suspension of equity accounting in ELF (carried at fair value as
    classified as held for sale).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Income statement impact&#160;&#151; $17.96m loss relating to ELF
    Pty Ltd which ceased equity accounting once classified as held
    for sale under IFRS. Under CGAAP, this investment is
    proportionately consolidated before being presented as held for
    sale.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(b)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Purchase
    price allocation
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group acquired Landmark in 2003. Under Australian generally
    accepted accounting principles, there was limited guidance on
    purchase price allocation and cash generating units. On
    conversion to IFRS on 1&#160;October 2004, the Group took the
    election to not restate prior business combinations which was
    allowed under IFRS 1 First Time Adoption of IFRS at that time.
    Under C-GAAP, the Group is required to allocate the 2003
    purchase price to the identifiable assets that existed on that
    date, with the residual goodwill and related tax impact
    allocated to the appropriate businesses. Certain of the
    identified intangible assets were finite lived and as such have
    been amortised.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Balance sheet impact&#160;&#151; Goodwill increased by $9.9m
    whilst the net impact on other identified intangible assets is
    nil (after amortisation of $73.9m).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Income statement impact&#160;&#151; No impact
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(c)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Income taxes
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under C-GAAP, deferred tax balances are presented on between
    current and non-current. Other sundry differences relate to the
    recognition of intangibles.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(d)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Securitised
    loans and receivables
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group transferred particular balances of securities loans
    and receivables to Trusts which are consolidated under IFRS.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under C-GAAP, these balances are not consolidated given that the
    recipient entities are Qualifying Special Purpose Entities
    (QSPE), as defined in C-GAAP.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Discount
    on purchase of receivables</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under IFRS, the discount on transfer of receivables to the
    Trusts is recognised over the discount period using an effective
    interest rate method. Under C-GAAP, the discount on transfer of
    the receivables would be recognised upon derecognition.
    Therefore, at 30&#160;September 2010, the adjustment requirement
    to the Statement of operations is the difference between the
    unamortised discount amount as at 30&#160;September 2009, and
    the unamortised discount amount at 30&#160;September 2010. The
    difference is immaterial.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Balance sheet impact&#160;&#151;  Decrease of $0.3m.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Income statement impact&#160;&#151; decrease of $0.3m
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(e)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Presentation
    reclassification
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The following presentation adjustments are necessary to present
    the consolidated balance sheet in accordance with C-GAAP:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Reclassify prepayments included in other assets to prepaid
    expenses
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Reclassify GST receivable included in other assets to loans and
    advances
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Reclassify goodwill included in intangibles to goodwill;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Reclassify share based payments reserve, included in reserves to
    contributed surplus and retained earnings
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-83

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">2009
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TD colspan="6" align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>AWB Ltd Group</B>

<TD>

</TD>
<TD colspan="6" align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>C-GAAP Adjustments</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="6" align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>AWB Ltd Group</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Joint<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Purchase<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="2" nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>De-recognition<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-84

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="45%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-85

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(a)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Treatment of
    joint venture entities
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under IAS 31 Interests in Joint Ventures, the Group applies
    equity accounting to its interest in joint venture entities.
    Under Canadian Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
    &#147;C-GAAP&#148;, in particular CICA 3055 Investments in Joint
    Ventures, these joint ventures are proportionately consolidated.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Balance sheet impact&#160;&#151; On application of C-GAAP there
    is a net impact of $20.9m decrease to net assets due to
    suspension of equity accounting in ELF under IFRS (carried at
    fair value as classified as held for sale).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Income statement impact&#160;&#151; $35.9m loss relating to ELF
    Pty Ltd which ceased equity accounting once classified as held
    for sale under IFRS. Under CGAAP, this investment is
    proportionately consolidated before being presented as held for
    sale.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(b)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Purchase
    price allocation
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group acquired Landmark in 2003. Under Australian generally
    accepted accounting principles, there was limited guidance on
    purchase price allocation and cash generating units. On
    conversion to IFRS on 1&#160;October 2004, the Group took the
    election to not restate prior business combinations which was
    allowed under IFRS 1 First Time Adoption of IFRS at that time.
    Under C-GAAP, the Group is required to allocate the 2003
    purchase price to the identifiable assets that existed on that
    date, with the residual goodwill and related tax impact
    allocated to the appropriate businesses. Certain of the
    identified intangible assets were finite lived and as such have
    been amortised.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Balance sheet impact&#160;&#151; Goodwill increased by $9.9m
    whilst the net impact on other identified intangible assets is
    nil (after amortisation of $73.9m).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Income statement impact&#160;&#151; $34.97m increase in profit
    or loss due to a lower impairment charge recognised as a result
    of the amortised intangibles and the tax impact of the
    amortisation of the intangibles.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(c)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Income taxes
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under C-GAAP, deferred tax balances are presented as current and
    non-current. Other sundry differences relate to the initial
    recognition exemptions relating to intangibles.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(d)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Securitised
    loans and receivables
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Group transferred particular balances of securities loans
    and receivables to Trusts which are consolidated under IFRS.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under C-GAAP, these balances are not consolidated given that the
    recipient entities are Qualifying Special Purpose Entities
    (QSPE), as defined in C-GAAP.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Discount
    on purchase of receivables</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under IFRS, the discount on transfer of receivables to the
    Trusts is recognised over the discount period using an effective
    interest rate method. Under C-GAAP, the discount on transfer of
    the receivables would be recognised upon derecognition.
    Therefore, at 30&#160;September 2009, the adjustment requirement
    to the Statement of operations is the difference between the
    unamortised discount amount as at 30&#160;September 2008, and
    the unamortised discount amount at 30&#160;September 2009. The
    difference is immaterial.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Balance sheet impact&#160;&#151;  Decrease of $0.7m.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Income statement impact&#160;&#151; Decrease of $0.7m.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(e)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Presentation
    reclassification
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The following presentation adjustments are necessary to present
    the consolidated balance sheet in accordance with C-GAAP:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

</TD>

    Reclassify prepayments included in other assets to prepaid
    expenses
</TD>

<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Reclassify GST receivable included in other assets to loans and
    advances
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>

    Reclassify goodwill included in intangibles to goodwill;
</TD>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-87

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="o66918o6691806.gif" alt="(ERNST & YOUNG LOGO)">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Independent
    auditor&#146;s report to the Directors of AWB Limited</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Report on
    the Financial Report</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We have audited the accompanying financial report of AWB
    Limited, which comprises the consolidated balance sheet as at
    30&#160;September 2010 and 30&#160;September 2009, and the
    consolidated income statement, consolidated statement of
    comprehensive income, consolidated statement of changes in
    equity and consolidated statement of cash flows for the years
    ended on that date, a summary of significant accounting
    policies, other explanatory notes and the directors&#146;
    declaration of the consolidated entity comprising the company
    and the entities it controlled at the year&#146;s end or from
    time to time during the financial year.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Directors&#146;
    Responsibility for the Financial Report</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The directors of the company are responsible for the preparation
    and fair presentation of the financial report in accordance with
    Australian Accounting Standards (including the Australian
    Accounting Interpretations) and the Corporations Act 2001. This
    responsibility includes establishing and maintaining internal
    controls relevant to the preparation and fair presentation of
    the financial report that is free from material misstatement,
    whether due to fraud or error; selecting and applying
    appropriate accounting policies; and making accounting estimates
    that are reasonable in the circumstances. In Note&#160;1, the
    directors also state that the financial report, comprising the
    financial statements and notes, complies with International
    Financial Reporting Standards as issued by the International
    Accounting Standards Board.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Auditor&#146;s
    Responsibility</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the financial
    report based on our audit. We conducted our audit in accordance
    with International Auditing Standards. These Auditing Standards
    require that we comply with relevant ethical requirements
    relating to audit engagements and plan and perform the audit to
    obtain reasonable assurance whether the financial report is free
    from material misstatement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit evidence
    about the amounts and disclosures in the financial report. The
    procedures selected depend on our judgment, including the
    assessment of the risks of material misstatement of the
    financial report, whether due to fraud or error. In making those
    risk assessments, we consider internal controls relevant to the
    entity&#146;s preparation and fair presentation of the financial
    report in order to design audit procedures that are appropriate
    in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an
    opinion on the effectiveness of the entity&#146;s internal
    controls. An audit also includes evaluating the appropriateness
    of accounting policies used and the reasonableness of accounting
    estimates made by the directors, as well as evaluating the
    overall presentation of the financial report.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Australian Accounting Standards vary in certain respects from
    Canadian generally accepted accounting principles. Information
    relating to the nature and effect of such differences is
    presented in note&#160;43 of the financial report.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is
    sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our audit
    opinion.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Independence</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 4pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In conducting our audit we have met the independence
    requirements of the <I>Corporations Act 2001</I>. We have given
    to the directors of the company a written Auditor&#146;s
    Independence Declaration, a copy of which is included in the
    directors&#146; report. In addition to our audit of the
    financial report, we were engaged to undertake the services
    disclosed in the notes to the financial statements. The
    provision of these services has not impaired our independence.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Liability limited by a scheme approved <BR>
    under Professional Standards Legislation
</DIV>
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A-88

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="o66918o6691807.gif" alt="(ERNST & YOUNG LOGO)">
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Auditor&#146;s
    Opinion</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In our opinion:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    1.&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the financial report of AWB Limited is in accordance with the
    <I>Corporations Act 2001</I>, including:
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="88%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    i&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    giving a true and fair view of the consolidated entity&#146;s
    financial position at 30&#160;September 2010 and
    30&#160;September 2009 and of its performance for the years
    ended on those dates;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    ii&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    complying with Australian Accounting Standards (including the
    Australian Accounting Interpretations) and the <I>Corporations
    Regulations 2001</I>.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    2.&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the financial report also complies with International Financial
    Reporting Standards as issued by the International Accounting
    Standards Board.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Emphasis
    of Matter&#160;&#151; Inherent Uncertainty</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Without qualification to the audit opinion above, attention is
    drawn to Note&#160;42 of the financial report. We note that
    there is inherent uncertainty surrounding the consolidated
    entity with regard to remaining legal actions arising from
    transactions under the United Nations
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Oil-For-Food</FONT>
    Programme (the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;Oil-For-Food</FONT>
    Programme&#148;). As the impact on the operations arising from
    the remaining legal actions has not yet been fully determined,
    there is uncertainty as to the resultant impact, if any, on the
    financial position, financial performance and cash flows of the
    consolidated entity and its operations arising directly or
    indirectly from transactions under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Oil-For-Food</FONT>
    Programme. The potential financial effects, if any, arising from
    these remaining legal actions are not contained in this
    financial report.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Report on
    the Remuneration Report</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We have audited the Remuneration Report included in pages 6 to
    17 of the directors&#146; report for the year ended
    30&#160;September 2010 and 30&#160;September 2009. The directors
    of the company are responsible for the preparation and
    presentation of the Remuneration Report in accordance with
    section&#160;300A of the <I>Corporations Act 2001</I>. Our
    responsibility is to express an opinion on the Remuneration
    Report, based on our audit conducted in accordance with
    International Auditing Standards.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Auditor&#146;s
    Opinion</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In our opinion the Remuneration Report of AWB Limited for the
    year ended 30&#160;September 2010 and 30&#160;September 2009,
    complies with section&#160;300A of the <I>Corporations Act
    2001.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="o66918o6691804.gif" alt="(-s- ERNST & YOUNG LOGO)">
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Ernst&#160;&#038; Young
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="o66918o6691805.gif" alt="(-s- ERNST & YOUNG LOGO)">
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    T M Dring
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Partner
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
